story:
What is Shisharca?

Shisharca is an extraordinary pillow. It is uncommon. It is extravagant. It is crazy. It is different! It is for the people who love to feel one with the nature.

Shisharca is a product that combines two very powerful anti-stress techniques – good night's sleep and relaxing pine scent. It is inspired by the nature itself and it is created to bring the freshness of the evergreen pine forest in the everyday urban lifestyle.  

Good sleep is the key to good health and sharp brain. As we spend approximately 1/3 of our lives in sleep, we better get the maximum rest out of it. Pine trees have specific aroma which is proven to contribute to the most pleasing sense of well-being.


What actually is this thing?

Shisharca is filled entirely with fresh pine shavings. The filling is made to order and stuffed in linen pillowcase. The combination of these two natural materials – linen and pinewood, makes Shisharca the ultimate organic pillow.

Yes, it is naturally scented!

These shavings are made of species called Pinus Nigra. In fact, the distinctive pinetree aroma is contained in the resin and this particular species is known to have a large amount of it.

No, it is not hard!

We have spent months in experiments in search of the optimal shavings’ thickness and shape. We developed a special process for creating thin and rolled pinetree shavings, and this results in softer and airy pillow.

A story

Shisharca is a product developed by a team of three young entrepreneurs - Ellie, Alex and Bobby, representing two small enterprises - one in the woodworking sector, and the other one in the IT sector. For three of us squeezing the last drops of energy throughout the day is a routine.

Having intense lifestyle and stressing about deadlines and setbacks is something normal for us.… But should it be this way?

The idea of a pine-scented pillow evolved naturally in response with the need for quality rest in the hectic everyday life.

Shisharca is inspired by a Japanese practice called shinrin-yoku, meaning “forest bathing”. Numerous studies showed that this preventive health care method reduces stress - the main cause of nearly all health problems.

Most of us are working some 40 hours/week. In addition, we are working on ourselves, we work on our relationships, we take care of the children, the chore, etc.

No matter how prepared we feel life always seem to take us by surprise and test our stress management and problem solving skills. For most of us, however, taking a long walk in the ancient Japanese forest is not doable on a daily (nor weekly) basis, but we can fake the same emotional effects by bringing the forest at home.

Shisharca is wonderful extension of your evening meditation routine and/or mindfulness practices as is involves an extra sense - the smell.

The special filling of pine shavings diffuses the aroma gradually and this specific aroma diminishes stress levels. It is like you have spent 8h outside, in the nature, you had the time to relax and recharge. Meanwhile, you haven’t left your bed! It is not a coincidence that pine tree aroma is often used in the SPA centres to relax their visitors and to provoke pleasant emotions of tranquillity and peacefulness.

The process - the road from the forest to your bed.

It all starts with the delivery of pine tree logs approved and controlled by Forestry in a mountainous region somewhere in the middle of Bulgaria.

We use a thicknesser to treat the wooden logs which are with controlled moisture content (MC) of 20+%. This way we ensure the right shape and resilience of the shavings.

Each Shisharca pillow is produced exclusively for its owner. Our system has only 3 easy steps:

  1. Receive an order
  2. Proceed the request
  3. Confirm the date of the shipment.

From the day of the confirmation, it takes up to 3 days to produce the pine shavings, to fill your Shisharca pillowcase, to pack it and ship it.

Our goal

Our sincere wish is to contribute for the wellbeing of as many people as possible. We are in love with Shisharca pillow and we are convinced that when you try it, you will feel the same way too!

In order to reach as many people as possible we will need to be loud and build a substantial online advertising campaign, build up and web store and show Shisharca to the world.

The money raised through this campaign will be used for covering the expenses for launching the product and online promotion.

Thank you!

Yes, Thank you! And we really mean it! Thank you for reading the campaign until here! Thank you for your support!

We will highly appreciate if you share our campaign to your friends and give them the chance to discover Shisharca!

story:
What an Embarque expansion?

Embarque is an ever-growing community. Every day we witness the incredible capacity for yoga to touch lives and create long-lasting vitality, and we intend to use every day as an opportunity for more people to truly live yoga.

Within these first two years of being open, we have grown to the point of requiring additional studio space for our evolving community. So, we are moving forward with an ever bigger vision and expanding Embarque to a new building with incredible potential - and only one block east from our current home. However, due to the size of the project, the need for additional yoga props and our hope to build a rope wall in the main studio, the financial scope goes beyond Embarque's capacity to do it on our own.  

Time and time again, we have heard the calls from all of your that you are ready, willing, and wanting to offer support. And now you can!

What will the Embarque expansion offer?

You will get to enjoy:

  • More group yoga and meditation class offerings
  • More mat and wall space
  • Larger, main studio with rope wall
  • Second, small studio
  • Expanded yoga and wellness workshop opportunities
  • Advanced teacher trainings and continuing education
  • 3 treatment rooms offering healing arts services, massages and facials
  • Welcome and reception area/desk separate from the studio
  • Ample parking and still walkable for the community
  • Additional bathroom facilities
  • More retail offerings, including yoga props and other related supplies
  • Modern apothecary retail area featuring loose-leaf tea and herbal remedies

What are we asking for?

Embarque has secured funding to begin construction; however, we'd really like to add a rope wall and invest in quality props, so we are asking for $10,000 to ensure we create the space we want for all of you. And with the magic we have witnessed within this community, we know just how possible this is.  

Any and all support for the Embarque Yoga + Wellness Studio Expansion will go directly into the project itself:

  • Rope Wall
  • Yoga props (i.e., bolsters, sandbags, blankets)
  • Contractor fees 
  • General construction (flooring, walls, painting, etc.)
  • Furniture and necessary furnishings

The perks are designed to offer you, our contributors, all the things you already love about the studio - including classes, memberships, and Embarque merchandise. 

*Class and membership perks are transferable to another name. Unclaimed class and membership perks expire December 31, 2017. 

Why yoga?

In the conversations happening throughout our community and the transformations experienced in Embarque classes and trainings, we have seen the power that comes with the practice of yoga. This practice has proven to affect change in individual lives, Indianapolis and beyond. And with that, Embarque stands firm in our vision to keep our studio and offerings inclusive and available to any and all who wish to experience and share the power of yoga.   

And it all starts with our physical space. This new space will make it possible for us to invite more people into our community, and to continue expanding the offerings that support all of you and the effect yoga and holistic health has everyone.  

Other ways you can support us!

We are so grateful for your everyday contributions to Embarque. If you are unable to support us financially at this time, please share this campaign with your community, family, and friends through the social media share tools. Your willingness to share this project and ask for support on our behalf is of incredible value to our mission. And we thank you for that. 

We are so grateful to all of your. We would not be who we are without you. 

With love and gratitude, 

Alyssa + The Embarque Team of Teachers and Therapists

story:
We are living in an air-polluted planet.

According to a recent report from WHO, more than 90% of the population in the world are living and breathing polluted air.

With more and more concern about pollution in the air outside, it is a surprise to find out that there is no index or measurement for the air pollution inside, especially when thinking about all the time you spend indoors, including offices, schools, transportation vehicles, and of course, homes.

We, therefore, developed AirQuality, a wireless gadget that allows you to measure and monitor the air quality in any indoor areas.

Measuring a wide range of Volatile Organic Compounds (VOC), Carbon Dioxide (CO2), temperature and humidity, AirQuality helps you to make the right changes and live a healthier life.

AirQuality is a compact device, powered by AA batteries, that monitors the air you breathe in real-time.

It is tiny, wireless and light-weighted.

It helps you to breathe better by collecting and monitoring the indoor areas in real-time, 24/7 non-stop. It also alarms you when there are dramatic changes in the air.

Based on the previous successful multi-award winning product of AirComfort, we spent months developing AirQuality to provide more information in helping users to further understand the air they breathe and, make the right changes.

Turn on the fan, open the window, or turn off the air-conditioner.

Sometimes, it is all those small steps that bring big changes.

Air pollution is the infamous invisible killer in the city.

Each year, an estimated of 6.5 million people died because of both indoor and outdoor air pollution.

Indoor air pollution alone causes an estimation of 4.3 million premature deaths per year.

Every breath matters.

Especially when you breathe up to 30,000 times every day until the very last moment. How you breathe, is then, how you live.

Especially when we spend, on average, more than 70 years of our lives indoors.

In other words, most of your breaths are/will be breathed in indoors.

#1: It alarms you when there is change in environment

#2: It helps to make the right change

#3: It reminds you when action is needed

Inspired by the look of a plant, AirQuality 'inhale' air and 'exhale' information and data. You can view all the information on your phone via our App.

How does AirQuality work?

AirQuality tracks indoor air quality so you can monitor that the air you breathe is healthy for you.

AirQuality does more than just detecting changes in the air. It also alerts you, and keep records in clear graphics to let you evaluate your efforts on keeping your indoor air fresh and healthy.

Why should I use AirQuality?

World Health Organization (WHO) has estimated 6.5 million people died each year because of air pollution. Indoor air pollution alone causes an estimated death of over 4 million. However, unlike outdoor air quality, there are no universal index or data for indoor air quality (IAQ).

This is why you need AirQuality, a wireless connected device that measures Volatile organic compounds (VOC), that includes toxic compounds as well as unpleasant smells, together with temperature and humidity in the surrounding area. It measures and provides information and recommendations for better living.

Does AirQuality need to work with an App?

Yes. AirQuality will sync wirelessly to the App “AirComfort”. You can then view all the information and statistics in real-time on your phone, as well as the histories of different time periods.

What is AirComfort?

AirComfort is our previous successful air sensor. Using BLE 4.0, AirComfort measures temperature and humidity in the air and transmit the data to your mobile phone via the App "AirComfort".

Will AirQuality alarms me when the air is not good?

Yes. You will receive instant notifications and/or alarms once there are changes in the air. You can also choose to customise your own alarms on different components (VOC/CO2/Temperature/Humidity).

Does AirQuality / AirComfort come with the battery?

No, but this is actually to save you some money. Due to the restrictions in shipping batteries these days, it would add around US$10 to the shipping costs as opposed to you buying the batteries at your local store for a few bucks so both AirQuality and AirComfort will be shipped without battery.

But no worries, any ordinary AA battery will fit for AirQuality. As for AirComfort, a coin size battery (CR 2450) would be enough for up to a year. 

How many batteries does AirQuality need?

Three AA batteries will be enough.

Do I need to water my AirQuality?

AirQuality is designed to ‘inhale’ the air and then collect data through the little holes on the leaf. Although it resembles the look of a plant, it does not need water to work.

You are recommended to use AirQuality in indoor areas only. And please do not water it ;)

Can AirQuality work in extreme temperatures?

AirQuality performs the best in environments between -25°C to +45°C / -13°F to +113°F.

What is the connection range of AirQuality?

20 meters in line of sight from the device using the App.

What kind of smartphones can AirQuality work with?

AirQuality is compatible with iOS 7.1+ devices and Android 4.3+ devices with BLE support.

What is the name of the App?

AirComfort.

It is now available on Google Play and App store. Below is the App picture of AirComfort.

Are there any monthly subscription cost in AirQuality?

No. There is no monthly subscription/cloud storage cost involved in AirQuality.

When will my AirQuality arrive?

It takes 5-20 working days for AirQuality to arrive at your front door, depending on your location, customs, etc.. Please note that this is an estimated delivery date from our carriers. On a rare occasion, your AirQuality could arrive outside of the estimated timeframe.

Where will you ship?

We ship to 25 different countries/areas. 

Below is the list of countries/areas we ship:

 

Is the shipping cost including customs and duties or other import fees?

Due to different taxations, customs & import policies in different countries, we are unable to include all the possible import fees in the shipping cost. Hence, all international packages may be subject to duties and taxes. You are recommended to check your local customs website for details. 

Send us an email at contact@ibebot.com.

Check out more about us! See the Press Kit here.

story:
Online digital solution for the empowerment of people with epilepsy

If you suffer from drug-resistant epilepsy, or are a relative or carer to someone who does, help us fund the development of an online platform to manage seizures. This new therapy, ACRT, is effective, non-invasive and affordable - based on 20 years of cutting-edge neuroscientific research in the UK. 

We are excited to launch this new service worldwide as our ultimate goal is to foster a global community of support for patients. Your help will enable us to offer affordable access to therapy for tens of thousands of people with drug-resistant epilepsy.

 

 

You will be able to access the ACRT platform on any connected device – desktop, laptop, tablet or smartphone. The only additional technology required is biofeedback equipment for measuring galvanic skin response (GSR) / electrodermal activity (EDA). This can consist of either electrode sensors or wearables , which are included with several of the reward packages for this campaign.

 

Important

It is important to use one of several Biofeedback Global recommended GSR/EDA biofeedback devices for ACRT therapy, with our instruction. Many currently available devices are marketed for relaxation purposes, and are not suitable for seizure management.

 

Learning seizure management at home 

 

ACRT is a behavioural therapy developed to help manage seizures. Through 12 interactive sessions, you will learn a specific set of skills to manage seizures. Once you have obtained these skills, the effect can last for many years. Each session takes about 45 minutes, and for best results we recommend allocating three sessions per week, over a 4-week period. During each session, you will receive instructions and practice the technique, which you can then start to apply in your daily life.

Introduction

First, a comprehensive introduction will instruct you how to work through the ACRT sessions. 

Session 1 

 

In session one, you will learn some basic knowledge to familiarise yourself with biofeedback training. 

Session 2 

 

 

From session two onwards, you will start learning techniques to manage your seizures. See the “Research and Results” section below for published trial results that demonstrate the effect of ACRT has had on different patients’ seizures - individual seizure frequency changes. Many people start to experience changes in the frequency and severity of their seizures over the course of the sessions, often during the first week.

 

About Dr Nagai

Dr Yoko Nagai is a neuroscientist based at the Brighton and Sussex Medical School, and a director of Biofeedback Global. She is a leading global authority on using behavioural therapy, involving galvanic skin response and electrodermal activity biofeedback, to address epilepsy. Her research started in 1997. 

In 2016, Dr Nagai received the Clinical Science Gowers Award from the International League Against Epilepsy, UK, in recognition of her ongoing research to better understand mind and body interaction in epilepsy. She developed many of the techniques used in the ACRT course by working one on one with patients with drug-resistant epilepsy over 20 years.

“It has been very rewarding working with my patients, but at the same time frustrating that I don’t have enough time to help more people. I would like to make my therapy directly available to people with drug resistant epilepsy, by building this online platform and offering it to the whole community. My vision is to establish a truly patient focused new epilepsy care service.  ” – Dr Yoko Nagai

 

What is ACRT?

 

How does it work?

ACRT is a behavioural therapy for self-help and seizure management. The therapy embodies both physiological and psychological approaches. Our thoughts and emotions are closely linked to our bodily responses and behaviour. Events in our daily lives trigger thoughts that in turn give rise to emotions. These emotions have the power to change both our bodily stress responses and our behaviour.

 

Psychological treatments, such as Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT), argue that psychological distress is caused by ways of thinking that trigger negative emotions and unhelpful behaviours. CBT helps you identify these distorted thoughts and correct them so that you can apply a more realistic and balanced way of thinking.

ACRT extends this CBT model by also taking a more holistic account of the role of the body in the expression of emotions and thoughts, and by working directly on the physiological aspects of wellbeing.

Published research shows that more than 80% of people with epilepsy consider stress and anxiety to be a major factor in causing seizures. It is therefore very important to understand the mechanisms of how the mind, brain and body interact. Drug treatments on their own cannot give this understanding

Using ACRT, you will see how your body responds to different thoughts and emotions. By receiving visual feedback about how your body reacts, you will be able to train yourself to become more sensitive to your bodily reactions and control your body’s state of alertness. Through this process, you will also learn how to stabilise your emotions.

 

Who is it for?

People with epilepsy who experience brief auras are particularly good candidates for this type of therapy. However this is by no means a requirement for a successful outcome. There are people without any aura who reduce the frequency of their seizures by more than two thirds after a month of therapy.

A modified set of instructions is given in the platform for those people who do not have an aura. People whose seizures occur predominantly with stress, anxiety and low mood are also good candidates. Unfortunately, clinical experience suggests that ACRT in its present form does not work as well for people who have a significant learning disability. 

 

Previously reported on (click logo to read):

Research and results

Dr Nagai's research started with investigations into how brain and peripheral body reactions are related each other. We think that when our brain gets excited, our body does too, but this is not always the case.

Dr Nagai measures and observes a body signal called Galvanic Skin Response (GSR) /electrodermal activity (EDA) which is very sensitive to our thoughts and emotions. You may know already that GSR/EDA is used in lie detector tests. Dr Nagai’s research has extensively investigated how changes in GSR/EDA also modulate different brain signals. To this end Dr Nagai has applied tools including electroencephalography (EEG) and functional MRI (fMRI). For people who would like to know more about the ACRT, you can find selected list of Dr Nagai's publications at (http://biofeedbackglobal.org/science/).

Results from the clinical trial

(adapted from Nagai et al. Epilepsy and Behaviour 2004, Vol 5/2: 216-223.)

(adapted from Nagai et al. Psychosomatic Medicine 2009, 71: 84-92.)

These participants all had drug resistant epilepsy,
and had been on different types of medication for many years
(for some of them, over 20 years).

The effect of the treatments over three years

(adapted from Nagai et al. Epilepsy Research 2014, 108: 149-52.)

(adapted from Nagai et al. Epilepsy Research 2014, 108: 149-52.)

Once a participant learns the skill of controlling seizures through the training sessions, the effect can last for many years.

The functional activity of distinct brain regions changes

(adapted from Nagai et al. Neuroimage 2004, 22:243-251.)

The functional activity of distinct brain regions changes over the course of the therapy. Our research shows that one month of ACRT training increases resilience of people to anxiety-related seizure attacks.

Time line
story_txt:
Online digital solution for the empowerment of people with epilepsyIf you suffer from drug-resistant epilepsy, or are a relative or carer to someone who does, help us fund the development of an online platform to manage seizures. This new therapy, ACRT, is effective, non-invasive and affordable - based on 20 years of cutting-edge neuroscientific research in the UK. We are excited to launch this new service worldwide as our ultimate goal is to foster a global community of support for patients. Your help will enable us to offer affordable access to therapy for tens of thousands of people with drug-resistant epilepsy.  You will be able to access the ACRT platform on any connected device – desktop, laptop, tablet or smartphone. The only additional technology required is biofeedback equipment for measuring galvanic skin response (GSR) / electrodermal activity (EDA). This can consist of either electrode sensors or wearables , which are included with several of the reward packages for this campaign. ImportantIt is important to use one of several Biofeedback Global recommended GSR/EDA biofeedback devices for ACRT therapy, with our instruction. Many currently available devices are marketed for relaxation purposes, and are not suitable for seizure management. Learning seizure management at home  ACRT is a behavioural therapy developed to help manage seizures. Through 12 interactive sessions, you will learn a specific set of skills to manage seizures. Once you have obtained these skills, the effect can last for many years. Each session takes about 45 minutes, and for best results we recommend allocating three sessions per week, over a 4-week period. During each session, you will receive instructions and practice the technique, which you can then start to apply in your daily life.IntroductionFirst, a comprehensive introduction will instruct you how to work through the ACRT sessions. Session 1  In session one, you will learn some basic knowledge to familiarise yourself with biofeedback training. Session 2   From session two onwards, you will start learning techniques to manage your seizures. See the “Research and Results” section below for published trial results that demonstrate the effect of ACRT has had on different patients’ seizures - individual seizure frequency changes. Many people start to experience changes in the frequency and severity of their seizures over the course of the sessions, often during the first week. About Dr NagaiDr Yoko Nagai is a neuroscientist based at the Brighton and Sussex Medical School, and a director of Biofeedback Global. She is a leading global authority on using behavioural therapy, involving galvanic skin response and electrodermal activity biofeedback, to address epilepsy. Her research started in 1997. In 2016, Dr Nagai received the Clinical Science Gowers Award from the International League Against Epilepsy, UK, in recognition of her ongoing research to better understand mind and body interaction in epilepsy. She developed many of the techniques used in the ACRT course by working one on one with patients with drug-resistant epilepsy over 20 years.“It has been very rewarding working with my patients, but at the same time frustrating that I don’t have enough time to help more people. I would like to make my therapy directly available to people with drug resistant epilepsy, by building this online platform and offering it to the whole community. My vision is to establish a truly patient focused new epilepsy care service.  ” – Dr Yoko Nagai What is ACRT? How does it work?ACRT is a behavioural therapy for self-help and seizure management. The therapy embodies both physiological and psychological approaches. Our thoughts and emotions are closely linked to our bodily responses and behaviour. Events in our daily lives trigger thoughts that in turn give rise to emotions. These emotions have the power to change both our bodily stress responses and our behaviour. Psychological treatments, such as Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT), argue that psychological distress is caused by ways of thinking that trigger negative emotions and unhelpful behaviours. CBT helps you identify these distorted thoughts and correct them so that you can apply a more realistic and balanced way of thinking.ACRT extends this CBT model by also taking a more holistic account of the role of the body in the expression of emotions and thoughts, and by working directly on the physiological aspects of wellbeing.Published research shows that more than 80% of people with epilepsy consider stress and anxiety to be a major factor in causing seizures. It is therefore very important to understand the mechanisms of how the mind, brain and body interact. Drug treatments on their own cannot give this understandingUsing ACRT, you will see how your body responds to different thoughts and emotions. By receiving visual feedback about how your body reacts, you will be able to train yourself to become more sensitive to your bodily reactions and control your body’s state of alertness. Through this process, you will also learn how to stabilise your emotions. Who is it for?People with epilepsy who experience brief auras are particularly good candidates for this type of therapy. However this is by no means a requirement for a successful outcome. There are people without any aura who reduce the frequency of their seizures by more than two thirds after a month of therapy.A modified set of instructions is given in the platform for those people who do not have an aura. People whose seizures occur predominantly with stress, anxiety and low mood are also good candidates. Unfortunately, clinical experience suggests that ACRT in its present form does not work as well for people who have a significant learning disability.  Previously reported on (click logo to read):          Research and resultsDr Nagai's research started with investigations into how brain and peripheral body reactions are related each other. We think that when our brain gets excited, our body does too, but this is not always the case.Dr Nagai measures and observes a body signal called Galvanic Skin Response (GSR) /electrodermal activity (EDA) which is very sensitive to our thoughts and emotions. You may know already that GSR/EDA is used in lie detector tests. Dr Nagai’s research has extensively investigated how changes in GSR/EDA also modulate different brain signals. To this end Dr Nagai has applied tools including electroencephalography (EEG) and functional MRI (fMRI). For people who would like to know more about the ACRT, you can find selected list of Dr Nagai's publications at (http://biofeedbackglobal.org/science/).
Results from the clinical trial

(adapted from Nagai et al. Epilepsy and Behaviour 2004, Vol 5/2: 216-223.)

(adapted from Nagai et al. Psychosomatic Medicine 2009, 71: 84-92.)
These participants all had drug resistant epilepsy,and had been on different types of medication for many years(for some of them, over 20 years).

The effect of the treatments over three years

(adapted from Nagai et al. Epilepsy Research 2014, 108: 149-52.)

(adapted from Nagai et al. Epilepsy Research 2014, 108: 149-52.)
Once a participant learns the skill of controlling seizures through the training sessions, the effect can last for many years.

The functional activity of distinct brain regions changes

(adapted from Nagai et al. Neuroimage 2004, 22:243-251.)
The functional activity of distinct brain regions changes over the course of the therapy. Our research shows that one month of ACRT training increases resilience of people to anxiety-related seizure attacks.

story:
Everyone will receive a unique piece, they will be made at your size! In case you need something specific adjusted, you can tell me. The clothes are vintage inspired, a tribute to the great stars of the past. Dancers, singers musicians, actors... Those days artist did everything: tap, trumpet, acting, you name it! And they were in style ;)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know some good training places, you want to train together, or exchange art? I am open to that! Make me an offer I can't refuse, and the trade is on! 

Namaste

story:
My name is Keegan McGinnis, I am a 20 year old university student from Halifax, Nova Scotia. Over the past six months I have really come to grips with how lucky I was to be born and raised in a country like Canada. I was fortunate enough to live in safe neighbourhoods, go to well funded schools, and play organized sports ever since I can remember. I also have realized the childhood I had is very different than what many children around the world are experiencing. I studied poverty and its relation to sport in developing countries, and ultimately took in interest in The Gambia, Africa's smallest mainland country, located on the Western coast of the continent. I learned that in The Gambia, over one third of the countries population lives on under $1.25 per day. Like many African countries, they are extremely passionate about soccer, but a real soccer ball is often a rarity. I learned that soccer balls are often fashioned by the children using garbage bags, string, clothing, and any other materials readily available to them.

With all of this information in mind, I went to work to develop a business that would not only help to solve this problem in The Gambia, but also put a great product in the hands of those who, like myself, benefited from the luxuries of growing up in a developed country. My Greatest Play is a clothing brand that consumers can be proud to wear, and dawn it knowing they provided a real soccer ball to children who may have never used one before.

Many people of The Gambia are anxiously awaiting the launch of our company, and because we do not want to wait any longer to make an impact, we have decided to run this campaign in hopes to be able to order 250 soccer balls for the children of The Gambia on or before launch day.

If you have any doubts in the impact your donation with cause, I will tell you a quick story to paint you a picture. Someone I am working along side with for My Greatest Play recently arrived back from a tour in The Gambia, and told me a story I will never forget. He said he stopped in a school of 2,700 students, and learned that the school had one soccer ball for the entire student body. This soccer ball was taken care of a person who worked at the school, their title? Soccer Ball Manager. The soccer ball manager was to protect the ball at all times, and also make sure the girls were not able to play with the ball. The reasoning behind it was that girls in this part of the country had no chance of going pro or receiving a university scholarship, therefor them having access of the ball was considered a waste.

Stories like this are what fuel our company, and put into prospective that one small donation or just one clothing item sold can make a world of a difference to those living in Africa's poorest countries. We will scratch and claw for every ball, knowing how big of a difference it will make across the globe.

If you are unable to make a donation at this time, that is okay! All we ask is you pass this page along to someone you think may be interested, and be sure to check back to our website on launch day (October 1st) for more exciting information.

Follow our Instagram page for exciting updates and announcements! @MyGreatestPlay

story:
Our Mission

To Bring the Healing Power of Yoga to Homeless Men, Women, and Children Worldwide. 

Yoga 4 Homeless is a non-profit project so your tax deductible contribution will allow us to provide yoga mats, classes and yoga instructors to guide classes for homeless in cities near you.

Right now the homeless epidemic is the worst it has ever been affecting over 100 million worldwide.  Homeless men, women and children are often dealing with significant personal challenges including traumatic stress, drug and alcohol abuse, mental illness, sleep deprivation and depression. 

Yoga has been proven to reduce: traumatic stress, addictive behavior, depression, mental illness, diabetes, and insomnia.

Five Powerful Benefits to Yoga: 

1. Yoga empowers the homeless to take action

2. Yoga increases a homeless person's self-esteem 

3. Yoga improves the ability to mentally and emotionally function in society

4. Yoga gives homeless a sense of community and well being

5. Yoga improves a homeless person's physical health and mobility 

Your contribution of $5 or more will allow us to provide yoga mats, classes and yoga instructors to guide classes for homeless in cities near you.

Yoga 4 Homeless Infographic & Model for Transformation

I think we all can agree that yoga is a powerful tool for the struggles the homeless face.  Yoga can help provide a foundation toward better mental, physical and emotional health with a higher quality of life. 

You can change a life, and it’s simpler and easier than you would have ever imagined.

Our Vision

Right now there is NO cohesive initiative with adequate funding and resources that provides free yoga to serve the hundreds of thousands of homeless that could benefit from the practice. Just imagine if every homeless shelter or community center nationwide and eventually worldwide was offering free yoga as a healing practice for men, women and children. 

Your contribution will go directly toward providing yoga teachers and classes into homeless shelters and community centers to help reduce trauma, stress and addictive behaviors within the homeless community. 

Yoga 4 Homeless is establishing a scalable model to do the following: 

1. Raise massive awareness regarding the homeless epidemic

2. Recruit & train yoga teachers to teach yoga to the homeless 

3. Create working partnerships with homeless shelters and community centers to offer yoga for free to homeless men, women and children

4. Build partnerships with yoga studios, yoga related and non-related companies to support the cause

5. Establish a Yoga 4 Homeless teacher training program to build a large network of certified yoga teachers around the world to teach yoga to the homeless


Listen to a Yoga Instructor talk about the Power Yoga has on the Homeless




Millions of Americans take classes to learn the poses and breathing of the ancient Indian practice of yoga. In recent years, yoga organizations have been reaching out to people who may not normally have the opportunity to take yoga classes, such as the homeless, trauma survivors, and people with drug and alcohol addictions. VOA's Deborah Block visited Green Door, a small mental health center in Washington where yoga is helping change people's lives for the better.

In the Press

The Yoga 4 Homeless has been an inspiring story that has caught the attention of numerous media outlets with more inbound interest everyday. 

Our Progress

In just three short months we are working with multiple homeless shelters in CA and TX and positioned to bring the healing practice of yoga to thousands of homeless men, women and children. Here is a news feature of founder Andrew Beinbrink passing out mats walking the streets in downtown San Diego East Village. The mats are very helpful for sleeping on instead of sleeping on the cold concrete.

                     

Our Supporters



About Yoga 4 Homeless 

The Yoga 4 Homeless mission is to bring the healing power of yoga to homeless men, women and children worldwide. Our team believes that yoga can provide a path toward personal transformation and equip homeless people with the tools they need to get off the streets and become functional in society. 

Yoga 4 Homeless was started by Andrew Beinbrink in December 2015 with a simple goal to donate yoga mats to the homeless so they wouldn’t have to sleep on the cold, concrete during the winter. After providing yoga mats to homeless in the San Diego community and hearing how much better they slept Andrew was inspired to provide more than yoga mats. 

Once the project started building more momentum, the next logical step was to partner with a number of yoga studios and local businesses including Lululemon. Realizing mats weren't enough, we spoke with local homeless shelters and community centers and saw the opportunity to bring the healing practice of yoga into the homeless community.

After a few months of research and studying the homeless epidemic, we decided to focus our efforts on bringing yoga teachers and classes to homeless shelters and community centers. We are currently working with a few shelters and homeless community centers in California and Texas and looking to aggressively expand. 
We are also establishing a Yoga 4 Homeless teacher training program and curriculum that we will be able to take to different communities and establish more qualified teachers.     


The Social Media Yoga Challenge 

Watch the How to Video to learn how to take the Yoga Challenge


For step-by-step Yoga challenge instructions Click Here 

Your contribution of $5 or more will allow us to provide yoga mats, classes and yoga instructors to guide classes for homeless in cities near you.

The Rewards & Donation Impact Levels

Yoga has already proven to be an amazing source of healing and personal transformation for the homeless community.  Your charitable giving will impact the lives of homeless men, women, and children by allowing our staff to bring them the practice of yoga, but we need your help. 

Choose from the Perk Levels that we have created and help support the Yoga 4 Homeless Movement by Pledging to our campaign and taking the Yoga 4 Homeless Challenge.




Exclusive Rewards Added 

San Diego fine artist Neil Shigley created the Invisible People collection that features personal portraits of homeless men and women and helps humanize the homeless epidemic. Neil has made a limited number of prints from his exclusive art collection available to donors at two sizes, the 18” x 20” print and three of his larger pieces at 4’ X 3’. The 18” X 20” print for $300 is priced for the everyday art enthusiast. The 4’ X 3’ pieces, which are impressive in their size and detail, sell for $3,000. Proceeds from any art sales are being generously split between Yoga 4 Homeless and Neil. 


The Impact

Our program benefits the following stakeholders:

-  Homeless men, women and children (teens) getting free access to yoga mats, professional classes and ongoing education

-  Homeless veterans (we intend on a class that would be specifically developed for veterans

-  Homeless shelter / community centers – provide them programming to support their goals

-  Yoga teachers contributing to teaching students and serving the homeless community

-  Yoga studios donating mats, promoting our program and also hosting classes at certain partner studio locations

-  Corporate partnerships supporting and promoting our program

-  Volunteers gaining the benefit of servicing the homeless community


 

Meet our Team


Risks & Challenges

Yoga 4 Homeless started in December to help support the homeless through the practice of yoga.  Being a new nonprofit means we have a team that is committed  to make the largest positive impact on the homeless we can.

The risks and challenges that we might encounter include resistance from local shelters to be able to implement a program such as yoga for homeless based on limited space staff or resources.

Our experience: In three short months we have partnered with four homeless shelters and community centers and have been met with warm reception. Yoga becomes a no cost community program to help their clients mentally, physically and emotionally. 

There's also a risk that the homeless participation will be very low and that the program will not be adopted and successful enough to continue.

Our experience: Homeless men, women and children are dealing with significant challenges and yoga offers a way to lower their stress level and also exercise in a safe comfortable environment. Our program so far has been met with enthusiasm from our homeless neighbors: 

Another risk is we are not able to find enough yoga teachers that are willing to teach the homeless. 

Our experience: We have had an outpouring of support from the yoga community and have already created a waiting list for yoga teachers. This prompted us to start developing a teacher training curriculum for Yoga 4 Homeless. 

The final risk is if we aren't able to receive the ongoing funding by corporate partnerships or private donations for the project. 

Our funding plan: We will utilize a multi-pronged fundraising approach to raise money for our program with a year around campaign model.

1.  Crowdfunding – 30%

2.  Private Donors – 30%

3.  Corporate & Foundation Grants – 20%

4.  Quarterly local fundraising events – 10%

5.  Local Partner Sponsorships - 10%

story:
Do you or a loved one have any type of serious allergy our medical condition that could require emergency medical assistance? 


Before now there were very few options to solve this issue.

Everyone is familiar with the standard emergency medical ID bracelets. They require engraving and you have a limited amount of space on which  to get important medical information. 

Then there are the newer USB ID bracelets. But, how many people carry around a laptop that would allow you to access the information on those bracelets?

Now there is the First Responder Smartphone Medical ID Bracelet!                

The First Responder Smartphone bracelet can help to communicate essential medical information faster to any EMS provider or person giving aid on the scene of a "distress" situation. 

With it's plug-and-play compatibility, the I.D. does not require you or any first responder to download an app in order to access basic triage information

The First Responder Medical I.D. Bracelet was created from a family incident that made me think, "What if I wasn't there to answer the questions on behalf of my loved one in distress to the E.M.T. that came to our aid? This can't be the only time this has ever happened."

My next questions were:

"How do EMT's gather information from disoriented people while doing on scene triage" As best as they can and then they fill in the blanks from a driver's license or later at a hospital.

"Can gathering triage information quickly reduce the amount of time before a person in medical distress receives care?" Yes.

"How can the current emergency medical ID be improved to speed up emergency on scene care?" Add easily accessible data storage.

"What tool does pretty much everyone have with them at all time that can help in an emergency situation?" Your Phone!


It will also dramatically increase the number of people that could possible assist a person in distress by having the ability to connect with any emergency contact or fully inform any 911 operator.

    You can easily store:
  • Name
  • Positive picture identification
  • Emergency contact numbers, which can be called or sent a text direct from any smartphone
  • Allergies
  • Current medical conditions
  • Current medications
  • Primary Care physician OR  You can easily load an Identification video for a loved one or child.

It also has alternative uses like:

  • Music data storage  
  • Project data storage
The Bracelet includes:
  • 8gb storage capacity
  • Standard USB adapter for loading data


What We Need

In order to start production, we only need to sell 350 bracelets. Since our backers will be pre-ordering them, we have cut the regular price in half!

  • Without data loading service - $45.99  
  • With data loading service - $55.99

Challenges:

The main foreseeable challenge is a delay in shipping caused by a customs hold up of the parts. The product will be assembled in the U.S. But, parts will come from overseas.

Other Ways You Can Help

I greatly appreciate any backing of any kind. I understand not everyone can contribute with money. But, sharing this project is just as valuable.
story_txt:
Do you or a loved one have any type of serious allergy our medical condition that could require emergency medical assistance? 


Before now there were very few options to solve this issue.

Everyone is familiar with the standard emergency medical ID bracelets. They require engraving and you have a limited amount of space on which  to get important medical information. 
Then there are the newer USB ID bracelets. But, how many people carry around a laptop that would allow you to access the information on those bracelets?
Now there is the First Responder Smartphone Medical ID Bracelet!                

The First Responder Smartphone bracelet can help to communicate essential medical information faster to any EMS provider or person giving aid on the scene of a "distress" situation. 
With it's plug-and-play compatibility, the I.D. does not require you or any first responder to download an app in order to access basic triage information

"Can gathering triage information quickly reduce the amount of time before a person in medical distress receives care?" Yes.
"How can the current emergency medical ID be improved to speed up emergency on scene care?" Add easily accessible data storage.
"What tool does pretty much everyone have with them at all time that can help in an emergency situation?" Your Phone!

It will also dramatically increase the number of people that could possible assist a person in distress by having the ability to connect with any emergency contact or fully inform any 911 operator.

Name

story:
"A lack of physical activity is one of the leading causes of preventable death worldwide."[1]

"Actively sedentary is a new category of people who are fit for one hour but sitting around the rest of the day… You can't offset 10 hours of stillness with one hour of exercise." –katy bowman [2]

Unfortunately, modern working practises are predominantly office based, if you work in an office, or any work involving sitting down, ask yourself: " how long do i sit at a time ? How long do you remain seated in a day? A week? You begin to get the picture.  Many office base workers are inevitably at great risk of sedimentary diseases.

Take a look around you, how many people do you know that spend their time seated for extended periods of time? Our modern lifestyle means we spend several hours a day on a seat, in front of the computer, TV, on a video game, when we travel; we are seated for unhealthy lengths of time. Some journeys, like by Air; there is no option of a break, UK to Australia, 16 hours direct flight time; will be spent seated on one spot. That’s purely unhealthy. By doing so, we dramatically increase the load and strain on our organs, necks and spine. Under this continual pressure and strain our body suffer under the toll.

According to Dr Clare Morrison, GP at online pharmacy MedExpress, sitting down for long periods can “lead to muscle atrophy in the leg and gluteal areas, where the muscles weaken and waste away”. [3]

“Prolonged sitting can lead to poor circulation, this could lead to swollen ankles, varicose veins and even deep vein thrombosis (DVT). - Steve Iley, medical director of Bupa UK. [3]

Over time resulting in significant damages to our spinal cord, neck nerves, and exposure to other health risks like Migraines, High blood pressure, Diabetes digestive issues, and spinal disc herniation (low back pain).

There is where Rocker kinetic comes in.

 

How It Works:

Rockerkinetic is a dynamic footrest powered by AI, and facilitates simple, unconscious leg motions which improves posture, improves blood circulation, stimulates the body and mind, reduces cramps and improve general wellbeing and health of users. 

Being so quiet and the exercise unlaborious; RockerKinetic doesn’t distract the user from regular work nor would it distract others around you.  The Rocking motion along with appropriate foot angles ensures a smooth and comfortable motion. 

RockerKinetic is like a portable gym and game console.

Designed in collaboration with chiropractors, doctors, and specialist ergnomics. It's the only dynamic footrest that improves your general wellbeing, posture, improves mental alertness, strengthens your calf muscles, same time providing you with an avenue to entertain yourself  and keep you engaged; with inbuilt games, competitive challenging games, all powered by the motion generated by the user as he rocks the Rocker kinetic.

After spending almost 18 months working on Rocker kinetic, we are finally ready to take Rocker Kinetic to mass production, and we need your help to make this happen!

 

Who is Rockerkinetic designed for?

Everyone- Everyone who seats for extended periods of time.

Office worker:

Rocker Kinetic is the perfect office footrest; Improves posture, mental alertness, reduces cramps, burn calories while at work. Increasing productivity , staying healthier and focused. Being dynamic- keeps user engaged. With easy games - keeps user entertained, you won't realise you are actually working out. Effortlessly keeping fit in the office. 

 

 

 

The healthy Game Enthusiast:

Rocker kinetic is built to be a new dimension gaming device, combining our quest for healthy living, exercising and gaming fun.

The Rockerkinetic Appstore is built on Unity open source, hence developer can easily configure and port their existing games to the RockerKinetic platform.  

Still, from actual Rocker kinetic gameplay.

 

Rehabilitation centers:

Rocker Kinetic can be used in rehabilitation centers to stimulate various leg muscles of patients; including ankles, knees, calves, toes, sole of the feet, Hamstrings, Adductors, Quadriceps, Gastrocnemius, Soleus and Tibialis anterior.  

 

Journey companion

Rocker Kinetic is a perfect travel/ journey companion, suitable for used in various modes of transports; including buses, coaches, trains and airplane as a de-stresser, an exercise unit, cramp buster, to improve metabolism, improve blood circulation, and as a gaming platform to improve general mood of passengers.  

   

 

 

Nursing /Care Homes
 
Rocker kinetic can be used in care and nursing home to provide first base exercise unit and a way to monitor activity progress of residents who wouldn’t find the gym convenient.
 
 
 

 

 

FEATURES OF THE ROCKER KINETIC:

 

PLAY:  The rocker Kinetic is used by placing both feet on the board and rocking the device from side to side. Utilizing unique algorithms to calculate Swing angle, swing rate, weight of the users, and other kinetic signature to compute metabolism rate, calories burn rates, actual effort put in, distance travelled in miles and kilometers. These parameters are then interpolated to drive a video game.  

• Option of ergonomic login- match of weight, BMI, and various kinetic signatures.  

• Option of Artificial Intelligence, or natural program aided assignments of the day, program for the day, and schedule for the day. Features of the Rocker Kinetic:  

Board: The board of the Rocker Kinetic is designed to be ergonomic, can be of various sizes and materials. Could be of various shapes and topped with various kinds of texture and aesthetic make-up. The foot area can be of any orientation, ideally longitudinal, same axis as the user, Symmetric to the axis of the user.  

Rocking wheels: The wheels are the mechanical balance, ergonomic pivots to orient and guide the swing. The rocker wheels are made of composite polymers.   

The rocker wheel could be of various shapes and orientations needed to achieve a rocking motion- eg could be of a polygon to achieve a jagged rocking motion, or a sphere to achieve a smooth rocking motion or circular to achieve an infinity motion.  

Electronics: The electronics consist of arrays of gyros, sensors, electromagnetic wave generators, Kinetic signature capture, stitched together to read and compute effectively swing angle, swing motion, kinetic motion and movement detections.    

Display: The Rocker Kinetic transmit display on various screen types, including the mobile phone, laptop, Tablet, Television, Projectors, etc  

Game Store: Rocker Kinetic has a unique app store, where games and other in-game boast, merchandise, stages; levels can be bought and unlocked. The Rockerkinetic Appstore is built on Unity open source, hence developer can easily configure and port their existing games to the RockerKinetic platform.  

 

Risks and challenges

We have confidence in our product design and manufacturability, and have actually produced a couple of units, but as with any hardware project, there are always potential risks associated with large scale manufacturing and supply chain logistics 

To minimize the risk, we will work with an experienced contract manufacturer who specializes in mass production.

We initially wanted the Rocker to be a 2017 Xmas gift, but to accommodate potential slippages in manufacturing and logistics we have pushed our delivery date to March, 2018. If all goes well though we might; just might be able to deliver for 2017 xmas. 

Whatever happens, we will keep our dear backers informed.

References

[1]  Lopez AD, Mathers CD, Ezzati M, Jamison DT, Murray CJ (May 2006). "Global and regional burden of disease and risk factors, 2001: systematic analysis of population health data". Lancet. 367 (9524): 1747–57. PMID 16731270. doi:10.1016/S0140-6736(06)68770-9.

[2] http://www.reuters.com/article/us-fitness-walki...

[3] http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/how-sitti...

story:
The Take-Pause Story 
 

Hi, I'm Dumeetha Luthra, I'm the founder of Take-Pause.

 

 

This is me in Iraq in 2003. I used to be a BBC war correspondent.  I’ve covered death and disaster all over the world. I believe you can imagine the pain and trauma I’ve witnessed.  To help me deal with what I'd experienced, I started practicing mindfulness. It was eye opening. It felt like I had been given a superpower.

 

I wished I’d had this toolkit as a child.

 

At the time, I'd been exploring virtual reality.
I loved how VR took me away from my surroundings. 

I was fully immersed and engaged. 

It was then that an idea began brewing...

What about bringing mindfulness to teens in a way they'd want to do it; maybe by combining virtual reality and mindfulness.

 

That is how Take-Pause was born. 
 

 

2 Years On

 

Now, two years on we have successfully completed a clinical trial in the pediatric emergency room at Maimonides Hospital in Brooklyn.

 

The single blind study found
that using Take-Pause
reduces pediatric patient anxiety by 45%.  
 

 

How it works

It’s simple. It is a breathing and focus exercise with a character and a scene.

There is little to do, just like mindfulness. There is no gamification - because we all have enough success or failure scenarios in our life. In Take-Pause, there is no doing it wrong. Even just sitting in the headset is relaxing and provides a break in the moment, and if you want to follow the character, it's even more beneficial. 

 

How you use Take-Pause

First the headset goes on, then choose a character, and then choose a scene. 

It’s that straightforward. 

 

It's engaging and helpful.

 

We call it health by stealth.

 

 

Hospitals, Clinics, Private Practices

 

Although we plan to introduce this into schools and universities, and even in homes, our initial focus will be with pediatric patients.  We plan to make every child's visit just a little bit less stressful, just a little bit less scary. 

 

 

 

 

Did you know...

- Every year 30 million kids visit the emergency room in the US alone. Another 16 million visit urgent care centers?

That means 46 million children need emergency medical help every year. 

 

Do you remember visiting doctors and hospitals as a kid? 

One particular incident has remained with me from those years; I was 14, I had scraped the back of my knee and it was not healing. My parents were taking me to the doctor. It was nothing serious, but on the way to the clinic, I sat in the back of the car with tears quietly streaming down my face because I listened to my worst imaginings.  Years down the road, I still remember that anxiety. 

Research shows:

- Anxiety can make pain worse and can make it difficult to cope with the pain.

- Anxiety can makes it harder to communicate the problem to a doctor or nurse.

- Anxiety can slow down the healing and recovery process.

 

We’ve built Take Pause
specifically for these high stress moments.

 

 

Clinical Validation

We began by informally piloting in Orange Regional Medical Center to great results.  

Then a clinical trial of Take-Pause began in the pediatric emergency room at Maimonides Hospital in Brooklyn. Maimonides was just voted one of the top hospitals in the country for clinical excellence. 

 

 

The goal of the study was to test whether Take-Pause reduced anxiety and if it did by how much. The trial has just been completed. 

 

It's official Take-Pause reduces anxiety
for pediatric patients in the emergency room.

 

In fact, Take-Pause was significantly more effective in reducing anxiety
than the control option - which was watching a video on an I-pad.

 

 

The product

 

We have developed a subscription based medical use platform. It's an easy to use plug and play system that brings together science and art, and it is almost ready for launch.  It combines, the hardware, the content, and a data portal to allow the doctor or individual to track progress.

 

 

We will sell the hardware as a bundle, and then the content will be available on a choice of monthly subscription plans.    

 

Our Team

We have 2 neuroscientists on our team, one of whom is also a clinical psychologist and mindfulness expert. 

 

All of these people have very kindly given of their time and skills to get Take-Pause to this level.

We’ve co-created the look with students 

Created by kids for kids. Although of course we let adults use it too!

 

 

Why mindfulness?

A mindfulness practice helps us for life. 
Research has shown that mindfulness helps reduce aggression and anxiety.

But we all sometimes find it tough to focus. Teens are no better. 

This is where virtual reality came in. 

 

Why in virtual reality?

It's immersive. It's easy to do.  It's an attractive choice for a teenager; hacking calm with technology.

There was another reason to choosing virtual reality, it is not just a toy. 

There is decades of medical research around virtual reality. 

"Over 30 years of academic research and over 3000 studies demonstrate that VR can improve behaviors, attitudes, and health."
Dr. Walter Greenleaf, Neuroscientist, Stanford University.

The explanation as to why virtual reality has been largely in the realm of research up to now, was that headsets were too clunky and expensive to be easily adopted.  Today headsets are portable and affordable.   VR in health care is set to become standard very soon. 

So the idea of combining mindfulness; which is clinically proven to reduce anxiety, with virtual reality; a technology that has been clinically proven to reduce anxiety, seemed like - if you excuse the pun - a no brainer! 

Mindfulness + Virtual Reality = TAKE-PAUSE

 

Why we need your support

 

We need some rocket fuel to finish the product.  

Our plan is to first introduce Take-Pause to 5 launching partners - which would be hospitals, medical centers, and private practices. 

Then we will move to expand around the country. Feel free to get in touch if you can connect us to a place that may be able to use Take-Pause. 

We've come so far,  and we're almost there. 
Now we need your help, to get us into orbit.

Either way we'll continue, but we'd love your help on this journey. 

 

In specifics your money will go to:

  • optimizing the experiences 
  • streamlining the data flow from the headset to the website
  • introducing it to doctors and nurses at medical conferences 
  • introducing it to hospitals and private practices

 

Goal

 

Maybe with Take-Pause kids will remember their hospital visit without the fear normally associated with such visits. Maybe they’ll feel more confident and resilient.  

 

 

How cool would it be that instead of asking for a pain killer, they ask for a bit of Take-Pause.

 

Together we can create positive impact. 

 

Perks

 

As part of the perks, we are giving access to specific segments of our subscription system without needing to get a subscription! If you have a virtual reality headset, you can enjoy the full VR experience. If you don't have a headset we have set it up so you can use this on a smart phone. It'll still be calming, but not as immersive and engaging. 

Thank You! You're great. $10 USD

A personal e-mail to say thank you. You are helping us on our mission to reduce teenage anxiety.

Stillness

$25 USD

This is a bitesize offering of our healthcare product. A customized 15 minute experience with unlimited access. Choose to relax with Hush, the butterfly, Toyo, the dragonfly or Kai, the dragon, in one of the 3 worlds we have created.  A sample of the experience is on the main page. Enjoy! :) The perk is compatible with phone or VR headset.

 

Get one, give one

$45 USD

As above, a customized 15 minute experience with unlimited access for you to use AND in addition you are buying one to gift. You can give it to your favorite teen or someone else who you may think would benefit from a bit of Take-Pause. A sample of the experiences is on the main page. Enjoy! :) The perk is compatible with phone or VR headset.

Buy 3 - gift 3

$105 USD

To help build your practice, we give you all three characters customized in 15 & 30 minute experiences. You get unlimited access for you to use AND to gift to a person of your choice. A sample of the experiences is on the main page. Enjoy! :) The perk is compatible with phone or VR headset.

The Take-Pause system

$800 USD $1,200 (33% OFF)

You will receive a one year license of the full system that we will be launching in hospitals and medical centers. You can track mood and change. This is only being sold to hospitals and medical centers. This perk needs a stand alone virtual reality headset e.g. an Oculus Go, or HTC Focus. It does not work on phones.

The system: Get one gift 2

$2,000 USD ($3,200 (37% OFF))

You will receive three 1 year licenses of the Take-Pause system. One is for you, and 2 are to gift to a hospital or medical center.  This perk needs a stand alone virtual reality headset e.g. an Oculus Go, or HTC Focus. It does not work on phones.

Unfettered Take-Pause

$10,000 USD

Imagine giving your local hospital or medical center of your choice Take-Pause. You will get 3 Take-Pause kits to get some calm straight away.

Another 16 million visit urgent care centers?That means 46 million children need emergency medical help every year.  Do you remember visiting doctors and hospitals as a kid? One particular incident has remained with me from those years; I was 14, I had scraped the back of my knee and it was not healing. My parents were taking me to the doctor. It was nothing serious, but on the way to the clinic, I sat in the back of the car with tears quietly streaming down my face because I listened to my worst imaginings.  Years down the road, I still remember that anxiety. Research shows:- Anxiety can make pain worse and can make it difficult to cope with the pain.- Anxiety can makes it harder to communicate the problem to a doctor or nurse.- Anxiety can slow down the healing and recovery process. We’ve built Take Pausespecifically for these high stress moments.  Clinical ValidationWe began by informally piloting in Orange Regional Medical Center to great results.  Then a clinical trial of Take-Pause began in the pediatric emergency room at Maimonides Hospital in Brooklyn. Maimonides was just voted one of the top hospitals in the country for clinical excellence.   The goal of the study was to test whether Take-Pause reduced anxiety and if it did by how much. The trial has just been completed.  It's official Take-Pause reduces anxietyfor pediatric patients in the emergency room. In fact, Take-Pause was significantly more effective in reducing anxietythan the control option - which was watching a video on an I-pad.  The product We have developed a subscription based medical use platform. It's an easy to use plug and play system that brings together science and art, and it is almost ready for launch.  It combines, the hardware, the content, and a data portal to allow the doctor or individual to track progress.  We will sell the hardware as a bundle, and then the content will be available on a choice of monthly subscription plans.     Our TeamWe have 2 neuroscientists on our team, one of whom is also a clinical psychologist and mindfulness expert.  All of these people have very kindly given of their time and skills to get Take-Pause to this level.We’ve co-created the look with students Created by kids for kids. Although of course we let adults use it too!  Why mindfulness?A mindfulness practice helps us for life. Research has shown that mindfulness helps reduce aggression and anxiety.But we all sometimes find it tough to focus. Teens are no better. This is where virtual reality came in.  Why in virtual reality?It's immersive. It's easy to do.  It's an attractive choice for a teenager; hacking calm with technology.There was another reason to choosing virtual reality, it is not just a toy. There is decades of medical research around virtual reality. "Over 30 years of academic research and over 3000 studies demonstrate that VR can improve behaviors, attitudes, and health." Dr. Walter Greenleaf, Neuroscientist, Stanford University.The explanation as to why virtual reality has been largely in the realm of research up to now, was that headsets were too clunky and expensive to be easily adopted.  Today headsets are portable and affordable.   VR in health care is set to become standard very soon. So the idea of combining mindfulness; which is clinically proven to reduce anxiety, with virtual reality; a technology that has been clinically proven to reduce anxiety, seemed like - if you excuse the pun - a no brainer! Mindfulness + Virtual Reality = TAKE-PAUSE Why we need your support We need some rocket fuel to finish the product.  Our plan is to first introduce Take-Pause to 5 launching partners - which would be hospitals, medical centers, and private practices. Then we will move to expand around the country. Feel free to get in touch if you can connect us to a place that may be able to use Take-Pause. We've come so far,  and we're almost there. Now we need your help, to get us into orbit.Either way we'll continue, but we'd love your help on this journey.  In specifics your money will go to:
optimizing the experiences 
streamlining the data flow from the headset to the website
introducing it to doctors and nurses at medical conferences 
introducing it to hospitals and private practices
 Goal Maybe with Take-Pause kids will remember their hospital visit without the fear normally associated with such visits. Maybe they’ll feel more confident and resilient.    How cool would it be that instead of asking for a pain killer, they ask for a bit of Take-Pause. Together we can create positive impact.  Perks As part of the perks, we are giving access to specific segments of our subscription system without needing to get a subscription! If you have a virtual reality headset, you can enjoy the full VR experience. If you don't have a headset we have set it up so you can use this on a smart phone. It'll still be calming, but not as immersive and engaging. Thank You! You're great. $10 USDA personal e-mail to say thank you. You are helping us on our mission to reduce teenage anxiety.Stillness$25 USDThis is a bitesize offering of our healthcare product. A customized 15 minute experience with unlimited access. Choose to relax with Hush, the butterfly, Toyo, the dragonfly or Kai, the dragon, in one of the 3 worlds we have created.  A sample of the experience is on the main page. Enjoy! :) The perk is compatible with phone or VR headset. Get one, give one$45 USDAs above, a customized 15 minute experience with unlimited access for you to use AND in addition you are buying one to gift. You can give it to your favorite teen or someone else who you may think would benefit from a bit of Take-Pause. A sample of the experiences is on the main page. Enjoy! :) The perk is compatible with phone or VR headset.Buy 3 - gift 3$105 USDTo help build your practice, we give you all three characters customized in 15 & 30 minute experiences. You get unlimited access for you to use AND to gift to a person of your choice. A sample of the experiences is on the main page. Enjoy! :) The perk is compatible with phone or VR headset.The Take-Pause system$800 USD $1,200 (33% OFF)You will receive a one year license of the full system that we will be launching in hospitals and medical centers. You can track mood and change. This is only being sold to hospitals and medical centers. This perk needs a stand alone virtual reality headset e.g. an Oculus Go, or HTC Focus. It does not work on phones.The system: Get one gift 2$2,000 USD ($3,200 (37% OFF))You will receive three 1 year licenses of the Take-Pause system. One is for you, and 2 are to gift to a hospital or medical center.  This perk needs a stand alone virtual reality headset e.g. an Oculus Go, or HTC Focus. It does not work on phones.Unfettered Take-Pause$10,000 USDImagine giving your local hospital or medical center of your choice Take-Pause. You will get 3 Take-Pause kits to get some calm straight away.

story:
Hacienda Wellness Retreat Center

Our serene private sanctuary fifteen miles from Downtown San Diego, California awaits you, and we have compiled a team of experts: personal trainers, nutritionists, life coaches, yoga and meditation instructors, wellness chefs, and massage therapists in the health and wellness industry to create a comprehensive program to help you learn and implement healthy habits and mindfulness presence. 

 

Just a few of the amenities you’ll find at Hacienda Wellness Retreat Center’s fully private resort include:

  • Juicing
  • Meditation
  • Nutritional advice and meals prepared by an executive chef
  • Follow up recipes for the future
  • Yoga
  • Life coaching
  • Journaling
  • Physical training
  • Day trips hiking through mountains or yoga on the beach
  • Spa treatments: Massage, cupping, facials, etc.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are rebranding and need to spread the word! Launching a wellness center is a BIG step for our property and we are so thrilled that you want to take that journey with us! Here are some details:

  • Our grand opening day-retreat is January 11th (This is a 5-hour event, NOT overnight stay)
  • Our very first official overnight retreat is January 12th where you can stay and enjoy 24 hours of health and wellness
  • Our first 3 night and 7 night retreats are also that same week, so come for the grand opening and leave in a day or a week, whatever you feel called to do! 

 

The Impact

With his mother’s passing in 2017, founder Joseph Harmes built this new wellness center in 2019 with the help of experts in their field, as a legacy to honor his mother who was a founder and volunteer in non-profits throughout the world. Joseph’s mother inspired him to give and provide to others the blessings he’s found on the Hacienda property. By providing the estate and access to life coaches, nutritionists, meditation gurus, physical master trainers, and yogis, he hopes to help others as his mother helped so many in her life. With your contribution and experience on the property, you will be living her legacy. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Launching a wellness center has its risks and challenges, but we would not be what we are today without them! Hacienda Wellness Retreat Center sits on nine acres of paradise that merges with a natural wildlife preserve. It offers beauty all around you to explore:

  • on-site koi pond
  • Buddhist meditation area
  • two orchards
  • vineyards
  • resort style pool/jacuzzi area
  • abundant wildlife

Thank you for taking part in this experience and helping us to continue to provide and honor this incredibly peaceful property to so many across the world. We could not do it without your contribution.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand you may not be able to make it to our wellness retreat center, but here are some other ways you can get involved if you feel called:

  • Tell your friends - word of mouth is still SO powerful, especially when it comes to your health
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign on your social platforms!! We SO appreciate every single share.

story:
One year ago my wife Ruthie suffered kidney failure due to  Glomerulonephritis. Ruthie's disease is called Goodpastures disease, which is rare in that it only effects .05-1.8 people per million. This was the cause of the Glomerulonephritis and resulted in complete kidney failure. We nearly lost her during a three week hospital stay and although she overcame the odds she is dependent on dialysis three times a week and needs a transplant as soon as possible. 

We manage a no kill animal sanctuary in New Mexico and there are many animals that need our care daily. Our love and passion to care for these animals is what drives our sanctuary.

We're trying to raise money to assist with the cost of prescriptions, medical co-payment costs, and follow up aftercare. We were lucky enough to be evaluated and accepted to the Mayo clinic and are on the donor list for transplant. We are trying everything to make this possible. Being employed by a non profit 501c3 we are of little means and have many rescue animals to care for. Our rescue pets need their mom and we're asking for your support and contributions.

We thought we were prepared for anything, however this has been extremely difficult. It's a complete life changer and we are burning through our retirement and savings so fast that by the time we actually get the transplant there will be nothing for after care or post transplant prescription insurance co-pays. We have been informed that those costs can be as much as $1,200.00 per month alone. The most expensive of the prescriptions should only be needed for the first year or two after she has a new kidney. We have set the goal high, but it's a two year plan and our research has found that kidney disease in the U.S. is extraordinarily expensive. 

Our Plan:

The plan is to reach our goal and allocate these gifts and donations toward the costs of Ruthie's co-pays for the first two years after her transplant. We opened a dedicated account to receive contributions and funds which will be used strictly for prescription co-pays and related medical expenses.

If you can't contribute please share this page with others. We need our campaign to reach far and wide. Small donations are welcome. If we can get a lot of people to help by just contributing a little we can reach our goal and Ruthie can continue the work she loves, saving animals!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT AND CONTRIBUTIONS,

With love,

the Raising Hope for Ruthie Team!
