What I Need      With that being said, my short-term goal is to start a small supplement retail store to get my foot in the door and break into the fitness industry. I have calculated all of the risks and weeded out the competition. I believe the ideal of my business and the entirety of the plan is guaranteed success and i am hoping to make a move before the opportunity is squandered. Most of the funding will go toward merchandise, rent, utilities, and employment.
     My problem is i come from a very humble background and as we all know, it takes money to make money. I have zero funding and with the economy in shambles no banks or lenders are taking any risks with start-up businesses. I am looking for any amount i can get. I have always been a hard worker so i am dedicated to make this work. Give me $50,000 or $5 dollars and i will be equally grateful for both. 
    The Impact      My passion for fitness is exponential. I have experienced how it has changed my life and the lives of others. Being fit generates happiness and a healthy life. It can reverse many life inhibitions and health deficiencies. The impact of helping my company is by growing the fitness industry. This industry is already estimated to be one of the fastest growing industries due to america becoming more and more self-aware. We have faced a huge obstacle larger than any other country has faced, which is obesity. Would you rather spend thousands of dollars on medical bills or go spend hundreds being in shape. Obesity is the lead cause to most of our country's illness. Increasing the fitness industry will decrease obesity and  decrease illness, thus decreasing the demand and inflation of medical expenses.

    Other Ways You Can Help  I know times are tough so i completely understand if you cannot contribute. A way you can still help is by spreading the world. Post this page on social media or any other way that can help the cause. Thank you so much!

story:
“We stare longingly at Apple's new Health app on our iPhones, only to discover it can't access our data. So back we go to tracking our information on multi-page printouts, or Post-It notes, or in our heads. We receive our lab results via fax, phone, in the mail, or if our doctors are willing to take the risk -- via email. We see news stories detailing the government's investment in the digitization of health and are awed that so much money and discussion can produce such limited results.”

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/x-prize-foundation/the-grim-reality-of-digit_b_5984580.html?utm_hp_ref=technology&ir=Technology/

Motaic Solutions is an early stage start-up company with a mission to improve healthcare and workflow efficiency by providing solutions that are interoperable, compliant, secure, cost effective, simple to implement and easy to use.  Our ultimate goal is to bring health care information into the hands of the patients AT NO COST to the patient in ONE easy to use place.

We need YOUR help to bring this goal into a reality with just $25. 

We understand technology.  We understand the market.  We understand YOUR needs.  We have the passion to bring healthcare management to YOU, in ONE simple, easy to use app.


The Wellness Portal enables complete integration with medical information from tests, devices, labs and prescriptions.  It’s a complete solution that enables YOU to be in control of YOUR medical information.  The Wellness Portal is not affiliated or owned by any specific healthcare institution so it's interoperable with any system, which gives you the freedom to change providers without losing valuable information.

The Wellness Portal synchronizes your personal calendar with your selected provider.  Make appointments on the fly or triggered from wellness reminders and automatically coordinate with your provider with a push of a button.  There is no need to call, miss appointments or to reschedule your previous engagements.

The Wellness Portal has an easy to use demographics screen that has all the information and questions you would typically be required to provide to a provider for a variety of healthcare specialties. 

The Wellness Portal allows you to share information YOU chose to a given provider.  This feature allows you to automatically provide new patient information in advance of your appointment or in case of an emergency, alleviating waiting room time and unnecessary paperwork.  This feature also allows a referral office to automatically receive your information so you are able to get the best and most affordable health coverage.   

The Wellness Portal enables you to view, store and retrieve your lab and exam results just as the physician would.  The medical device and EMR plug-ins enable your test result data to be converted to a known format that can be sent directly to your Wellness Portal app via the cloud.  Increase confidence in your care and save time and money by having YOUR test results in your hands once they are ready.  YOU no longer have to wait for your results.  You no longer have to retest when past results are lost. 

Help us bring FREE Patient Centric Care into a reality with your generous contributions.  We have over 17,000 views so far,  but in order to bring this FREE product to the market we rely on your contributions for development and marketing.  Please also spread the word by sharing this Indiegogo campaign with your friends, family and colleagues. Simply click on any of the Facebook, Twitter or other icons below.

Our team has dedicated their careers to improving healthcare by increasing efficiencies.  We understand the GAPS in the market and believe we have the solution and the right motivation to make a monumental shift in patient care.

Shawnnah brings over 15 years of product development experience in the medical device industry and has spent a significant amount of time focused on connectivity solutions, specifically in software.  She can CODE. 

Jesse brings over 10 years designing and developing applications for healthcare, education, and research. He can ARCHITECT & DESIGN.

Jessica brings over 11 years of business development in the IT industry.  She can effectively engage and influence customers to create opportunities for long-term value.  She can SELL.

We have recently completed the concept phase which included:
  • customer use cases
  • product requirements
  • high level architecture
  • wireframes
  • development tools
  • platforms supported
  • performance criteria

We are currently in the prototyping phase and have implemented a workflow to send and receive data from the medical device and EMR to the cloud.  Our next step is to develop the mobile application to connect to the cloud and push and pull patient data to YOU.  Funds will be used to mature the prototype and launch the mobile app.

A complete set of wireframes have been drafted, these are now being digitized.

Prototype and validate workflow with real users such as yourself.

In addition to the Wellness Portal, Motaic Solutions will develop Medlink, a suite of software along with a software development kit targeted at medical device manufactures and EMR companies enabling physicians to easily connect with their patients from ANYWHERE at ANYTIME.

Complete architecture has been drafted and the Device Driver and Server have been prototyped.

                           

Prototype complete workflow.

Phase 1 is complete! Phase 2 has already started! Help US continue our momentum.

Our goal is to raise $600,000 in order to develop and market  first release of the product .  Our team is very technically savvy and can guide and contribute to the development.  Amongst us we have launched over 10 complex software products from medical devices, clinical applications to EMR.  We know the INDUSTRY.  We know SOFTWARE.  We believe client feedback is essential, thus our perks enable you to be part of the development team and help shape the future of healthcare.


We are VERY passionate about our idea and are dedicated to turning our dream into a reality, but we cannot do this without your contributions.  You can check our progress on www.motaic.com.

                              Every 10 days we will unlock a new feature.

Our biggest risk is adoption rate of the Medlink Data SAAS by healthcare providers which make the Wellness Portal even more valuable to YOU.  One approach is to seed the market with the Wellness Portal that will create a pull effect.  We believe we will be successful because we have been able to obtain over 2000 views a day, so once the FREE Wellness Portal is available the adoption rate should be high.  We also intend to market to smaller practices who can provide the Wellness Portal as a service to their patients, attracting more patients into their practices by providing value.  We have experience with launching client building campaigns for small practices and have seen great success.  We plan to take a similar approach. 

Our current pro formas indicate we have a high risk of becoming cash flow negative by year two.  Our investments will be used wisely. Our team is willing to put in extra effort and hours to successfully launch a beta version of the product by the end of this year.

Given our extensive experience with product development we understand that throughout the process we may experience unperceived or unplanned risks along the way, we have planned some contingencies into our schedule to allow time for investigation and mitigation. 

FAQs

I have a concern over the confidentiality of my data.

We all do, our data is private and should be treated as such.  The Wellness Portal allows you to keep your medical history outside of the cloud within your local storage.  You only post your medical information to the cloud when you need to provide the information to a specific provider or if you are comfortable hosting your data within the cloud.  No one else will have access to your data unless you authorize it.  Your data is secure and encrypted and you own the encryption key.

Do I have to share all my data?

No, you own your medical data.  Your data is personal to you.  The Wellness Portal mobile app will allow you to choose who you send data to, under what conditions and how much.  For instance you can choose to share only your dental history with your dentist while keeping the rest of your medical history private.

story:
CECIBEL ZAMBRANO - EYE CANCER

My best friend was diagnosed with cortical melanoma (eye cancer) last December 2014. In my country Ecuador, we don´t have the technology to help her. The only solution the doctors gave her was to extract her tumor and her eye with it.

She needs to get this eye cancer treatment: brachytheraphy, to avoid taking off her left eye. The cost at Will'sEye Hospital, the best in this type of cancer is around $100,000.00. So we started a campaing through Facebook, with the FanPage Ayudemos de Cecibel Zambrano. 

As you can see the amount is high, so we still need all the help we can to pay for her treatment, hospitalization, airplane ticket, transportation, food and lodging.

However, if we don´t get the total amount, she will use it for the chemos and radiotherapy, to avoid the cancer to spread to her right eye.

Please, we need you to share this campaign with your friends, no matter where they live, Use all the medias as possible, share this link in your walls https://www.facebook.com/ayudemosaceci?fref=photo, in Twitter as #ayudemosaceci. Share at morning, evening and night, remember that all your friends don't check out the medias at the same time.

FRIENDS DON'T LET FRIENDS FIGHT CANCER ALONE! LET'S BEAT THIS EYE CANCER! TKS!

story:
Small health clinic in a poor area of Nicaragua

The clinic serves between 15-25 patients each day, for the most part they are children who live on the streets or in temporary housing.  The clinic is also used by other groups as a distribution center for things like shoes, food and glasses. There is currently one doctor (myself) who works here as well as 2 non-medical volunteers from the local community who help.  At times we also have volunteers come from a local medical school.

The clinic is of course free for the patients and we provide  medications as well as transportation to a hospital when needed.  For the most part, I have been funding the clinic myself for the past two years.

After a recent trip to Haiti and some other events, I have come to realize that I should treat the clinic as a more long-term project rather than running it as temporary mission trip.

What We Need 

The main reason I created this page was just for the purchase of basic medical equipment like you would find in any small clinic.  For the past two years, I have basically been running the clinic ´out of my bag´ if that makes sense.  While this certainly works, it also significantly lowers the quality of care we can provide as well as causes frequent closures of the clinic when we need to take a patient to the hospital (about 30 minutes away) because we lack basic equipment.

I buy medications and basic supplies monthly, things for cleaning and bandaging wounds, sutures, sterile water etc.  The purpose of this page is not to buy these type of things, but instead for equipment that will help us provide better care.

This is a partial list of some of the  things the money will be spent on:

1. Pulse Oximeter - Probably the leading cause of unnecessary trips to the hospital. Because of the location of the clinic near constantly burning garbage fires, we deal with a huge amount of respiratory problems.

2. Exam Lighting - For security reasons, buildings like ours are built with very little windows.  As you can see in the photo, the clinic is very dark and overhead lights do not provide enough light.

3. Otoscope - Used for examining ears.  Currently I just have a portable unit that isn´t very useful.

4. Rapid-read ear thermometers - greatly improved accuracy and usability compared to glass thermometers

5. Mini-refrigerator - Allows us to use  certain medications in the clinic that we otherwise need to take the patient to the hospital to receive. Also allows us to store certain samples all day, rather than waiting til the end of the day to take the sample.  I drop off samples to the lab at the end of the day. Finally some other supplies could be kept in the clinic such as IV solutions.

6. Oxygen - A small oxygen deliver system. Respiratory problems account for about half of our patients.

These would be the highest priority items, and if funding is still available, things like a glucometer, an actual exam table, and some emergency equipment would be purchased.

Other Ways You Can Help

I mention this everywhere, but we can always use any visitors we receive, either medical or non-medical people.  I have two volunteers from the community who do nothing except play with the kids and entertain them while they are waiting.  It is a huge help.  The more the merrier.  Of course any medical personal who would like to come and allow me to take a break without closing the clinic would be awesome also.

story:
Greetings . . .

Thank you for your interest in supporting my cause . . .

Very simply, I am raising funds to pay for my extensive dental work that is needed to save my teeth from extraction . . .

To do this i will require root canals and structual refitting on at least 5 of my molars, as well as frontal cosmetic and structual work to repair the damage done by years of an acid reflux condition, as well as faulty dental work that had been done in the past . . .

I have researched many dentists and found a most highly recommended and talented Italian dentist who specializes in the type of work that I require . . .

The cost of the initial consultations and preliminary work has caused a great imbalance in my personal budget which has created a situation where I have become unable to pay the next 2 months of my rent . . .

In order to complete my dental work, save my teeth, and keep myself from being evicted from my apartment, I will need to raise more than £7,000, or almost $12,000 USD. . .

My goal is to raise £10,000 ( $15,000 USD ) so that I can pay for my dental work, catch up on my rent, and create the small nest egg that I had in the past to allow me to keep my regular cost of living expenses fulfilled, and have my life return to a safe cycle of existance . . .

Any amount of resources that you can donate toward my cause will be greatly appreciated and shall payed forward to others who are in need . . .

Many thanks for your time & consideration of this message, and for your thoughts, prayers, and donations toward helping me restore my health & welfare . . .

All the very best to you and yours !

Sincerely, 

Kendall Emmerson Ross

story:
A Novel Energy and Immune Boosting Nutrient with Anti-Cancer and Anti-Aging Activity

Time to gather funds for extensive study and testing of the favourite and essential oil we love so much. Come join us!

Background and Significance

The shark is a member of the Elasmobranch subclass of fish that includes the ratfish (Chimaera monstrosa). Nearly all species of sharks are known to have an extraordinary resistance to the growth of tumors and infections (1,2). Many investigations have indicated an extremely low incidence of cancer in sharks or even that no cases of cancer in sharks have been recorded (1,2). The emerging hypothesis is that n-3-polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFA) and other shark liver oil (SLO) components may exert anti-carcinogenic effects (3). SLO contains both alkylglycerols (AKG) and squalene that are anti-carcinogenic and anti-bacterial agents and have been used as an ancient remedy among the fishermen along the west coast of Norway and Sweden. It has been used for wound healing, the treatment of irritations of the respiratory and alimentary tracts and lymphadenopathy. Alkylglycerols have been in use in northern Europe for more than 50 years to assist with the prevention and treatment of cancer. They are also in widespread European use to help the immune system function more efficiently to combat infection and respiratory ailments such as asthma. New science is extending the use of this novel nutrient into the realm of anti-aging, especially for immune cells and the cardiovascular system. It has antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties and can contribute to cell membrane function in ways that help cells regulate health more efficiently – the opposite of the trend of aging.

        

The Chimaeras are a very primitive group of fish, with skeletons composed of cartilage instead of bone, dating back for more than 300 million years. They are true survivors from before the dinosaurs, and have changed very little since. They may actually be the oldest and most enigmatic groups of fishes alive today. The ratfish is an extraordinary fish found in all the world's oceans, close to the bottom, at depths of 300–500 meters, with a reported maximum depth of 1,663 meters. These fish are almost half shark and half ray, with smooth skin, big sparkling green eyes designed to see in the dark depths, a rabbit-like face, and a small mouth surrounded by large lips. The nose of the ratfish is studded with electric sensors able to detect the faint electrical signals given off whenever bottom dwelling prey – including crabs, snails, starfish, marine worms, urchins, clams, shrimp, and small fish – use their muscles, and sensitive enough to detect their heartbeats. Their bodies taper to an exceptionally long threadlike tail, and together with their rodent-like teeth designed for crushing the shells of their prey, has earned them the common name “ratfish.”

Ratfish (Chimaera monstrosa) Distribution

Distributed in Eastern Atlantic, mostly in Northern Norway and Iceland, Skagerrak and Kattegat south to Morocco including western Mediterranean (some isolated records from eastern part), Azores and Madeira Islands. Records from South Africa are questionable. Reported from Oshima, Japan.

Figure 1. The red areas on the map show the distribution of Ratfish (Chimaera monstrosa).

   

Extraction of Liver Oil

The ancient Norse Vikings were consumers of liver oils, in particular codfish liver oil, Chimaera monstrosa (ratfish) liver oil, and shark liver oils. Codfish liver oil was used for the maintenance of general health, particularly during the cold months. These months are characterised by low sunlight intensity and an increased risk of hypovitaminosis D (vitamin D deficiency). Such a deficiency can have tragic consequences in light of the fact that vitamin D has been shown to play very important roles in brain, heart, immune system and bone health. Unlike codfish, Chimaeras are mainly confined to the very deep waters and as such were not in plentiful supply for the Vikings, who considered the oil from their liver to be a rare and precious gift from the sea, naming it ‘Gold of the Ocean’. The ancient Norse Vikings and fishermen were well-versed in isolating liver oils and used two very rare, and largely unknown, methods. They had a deep understanding of nature, since they lived in the wild, and both methods were based on nature’s principles. The fish liver must have a specific appearance and come from a fish of a specific age otherwise it was never used for the production of liver oil. You can also see at the bottom right hand side of the image a ceramic knife. We never use metal to manipulate the livers because of fear of oxidation which can adversely affect the final quality of the product.

Figure 2. The picture shows a team member is removing a fish liver by use of 'ceramic' knife.

The quality of fish liver oil is highly dependent on the quality of the liver just like the quality of olive oil is dependent on the quality of the olives. A fresh ratfish and codfish liver is pale with an almost cream-coloured appearance. It should also be beautifully plump and very soft to the touch. Ideally, the rendering process should begin immediately following the removal of the fresh livers and at least before putrefaction has commenced. This results in the lightest coloured oil. The process used to capture the oil was remarkably simple and probably has its origins in ancient time. The Ancient Nordic people observed that fish livers vary in appearance, size and texture depending on the seasons etc. The raw oil naturally separates from the livers without any intervention. This can be done by allowing fresh fish livers to freeze in the cold weather and then moving them to a room which is at the temperature of the Norwegian summer months, the livers will begin to thaw and at the same time the raw liver oil naturally separates from the livers. This ancient method based on nature’s principles captures & preserves the freshness, nutrients and health benefits of the oil. The nutritional content of an oil produced using this age-old method is identical to what you would find in the liver oil of a ‘living’ wild codfish. We make no attempt to alter the nutrient levels. Nature dictates the nutrient levels in our oils. That is how it was created by ancient Nordics and that is how it should always be.

Figure 3. The oil separates from the liver without any manipulation.

The other rare method employed by the Norse Vikings, and used on special occasions, involved the whole fish. This method eliminates the need to remove the livers. The ancient Norse Vikings would simply hang a ratfish up by its long tail, and after a period of time the liver oil would start to drip from the end of its nose. After a certain amount of time has elapsed, oil from its large oily liver will then begin to accumulate around its nose. The picture below shows this. The oil is remarkably clear, pale-coloured and sweet smelling.

    

Figure 4. After a certain amount of time, oil from its large oily liver begins to accumulate around its nose.

The oil would then begin to drip and can be collected. The oil produced using this method is held in particular with high regard by the ancient Nordic people and Norse Vikings believed it to be extremely powerful, not only containing the therapeutic elements present in the liver but also those from other organs of the fish as well. Its use was therefore reserved for special occasions.

An Ancient Remedy Used by the Norwegian Vikings

The ancient Vikings and Scandinavian fishermen considered the oil derived from the large oily liver of the ratfish as a precious gift from the sea. They used this rare oil for maintaining general health as well as for specific purposes, including wound healing and the treatment of general debility, infections, irritations of the respiratory and alimentary tracts, and glandular disease. It was also applied topically to decrease inflammation and pain, to promote the healing of wounds, and as a skin elixir. The liver of the ratfish is very large, constituting approximately 60% of its total body weight, and contains an exceedingly high proportion of oil. Ratfish liver oil (RLO) is one of the finest antioxidant lubricants known, having been used for guns and fine delicate instruments. Some fishermen used ratfish liver oil as a lubricant and rust preventer. Its characteristics in common with Sperm whale oil, which was used as a lubricant for the finest pocket watches.

Alkylglycerols (AKGs) have been used in Northern Europe for more than half a century to assist with the prevention and treatment of cancer, a disease that hijacks biological processes and uses them to its own advantage. The human body has developed many strategies to use nutrition to help combat this problem, often means that healthy cells can use a nutrient to enhance their wellbeing while the very same nutrient can help to kill cancer cells. This is a common mechanism with many nutrients such as tocotrienol E, quercetin, curcumin, green tea, and DHA.

We now know that AKGs can readily accumulate in cell membranes, naturally binding to the membrane lipids. Human cells can use AKGs for healthy purposes including cell signaling and antioxidant defense. Cancer cells appear to have genuine and serious problems with AKGs, which are ether lipids that are abundant in the liver of some Elasmobranch fish species such as the ratfish and certain sharks. AKG are one of the most abundant compounds in RLO. These ether lipids are plentiful in the liver of some elasmobranch fish species such as ratfishes and some sharks. Shark liver oil from Centrophorus squamosus (SLO), or alkyl-Gro mix from this source, have several in vivo biological activities including stimulation of hematopoiesis and immunological defenses (4), sperm quality improvement, or anti-tumor and anti-metastasis activities. Several mechanisms are suggested for these multiple activities, resulting from incorporation of alkyl-Gro into membrane phospholipids, and lipid signaling interactions. Natural alkyl-Gro mix from SLO contains several alkyl-Gro, varying by chain length and unsaturation. Six prominent constituents of natural alkyl-Gro mix, namely 12:0, 14:0, 16:0, 18:0, 16:1 n-7, and 18:1 n-9 alkyl-Gro, were synthesized and tested for anti-tumor and anti-metastatic activities on a model of grafted tumor in mice (3LL cells) (4,5). 16:1 and 18:1 AKG showed strong activity in reducing lung metastasis number, while saturated AKG had weaker (16:0) or no (12:0, 14:0, 18:0) effect. Multiple compounds and mechanisms are probably involved in the multiple activities of natural AKG (4,5).

Key Nutritional Features of Ratfish Liver Oil (RLO)

I. Ratfish Liver Oil contains Fat-Soluble Vitamins (A, D3 and E), Phytosterols (campesterol, stigmasterol and ∆5-avenasterol) and a wide spectrum of naturally occurring Fatty Acids (omegas 3, 4, 6, 7, 9, & 11).

II. The long-chain omega-3s (EPA and DHA) - which come mainly from fish and seafood (particularly fatty fish) – are essential fats meaning that the body cannot make them from scratch but must get them from food.

III. Omega-3s support healthy brain, eye, and immune system function. EPA and DHA contribute to the normal function of the heart, help keep blood pressure in the healthy range, and support flexible joints.

IV. In the fetus and in breastfed infants DHA contributes to normal brain and eye development. Besides these nutrients, Ratfish Liver Oil has been found to contain exceptionally high amounts of biologically active lipids (fatty substances) called “Alkylglycerols” making it very different from other fish liver oils.

What are the Sentiments Behind This Campaign?

We all love fish and essential oils. We need using them and studying them. The purpose of this fundraising campaign is to support the project that is designed to confirm the anti-cancer activity of RLO and its underlying molecular and cellular mechanisms. In addition to previous and current studies, the testimonials of our clients have revealed multi benefits of RLO. Accordingly, we believe that RLO is a good candidate for further study, specifically for the purpose of cancer therapy.

Our Ongoing Research Study

As part of our cancer research study we have recently verified the antineoplastic effects of Ratfish Liver Oil (RLO) rich in alkylglycerols in normal and human breast cancer cell line. To determine whether Ratfish oil alter the expression of few selected genes and caspaces such as p14Arf, p21, p53, Dmp1 and caspace 3, RT-PCR as the initial verification step was performed. Alongside the expressions of oncogenes such as Her2 and Ras were verified. Here we have shown the results of our RT-PCR study following the exposure of normal breast cells (MCF10A: human mammary epithelial cell line) and cancer cells (MCF-7: Michigan Cancer Foundation-7, human breast adenocarcinoma cell line) to the oil for three days (72-hour). GAPDH was used as internal standard in this RT-PCR analysis and the data were expressed as relative expression of each gene by use of GAPDH as control (Table 1). In next step we will analyse the corresponding protein synthesis by use of western blot.

RT-PCR data showed that RLO induced the expression of p53, p21, p14Arf, Dmp1 and caspase 3 in MCF-7 cells. In contrast Her2 expression was inhibited by this oil and Ras activation did not show any significant changes. In MCF10A (normal cells) only Dmp1, p53, p21 and caspac3 were induced at 4mg/ml concentration. The oncogenes do not show significant changes. The data signify the anti-cancer activity of RLO toward MCF-7 cancer cell line. It is noted that RLO is safe at 2 m/ml for normal cells.

Table 1. Gene expression pattern of tumor suppressors, apoptotic genes and oncogenes (red columns) after 72-hour exposure of normal human breast epithelial cells (MCF10A) and breast cancer cells (MCF7) to RLO.

The boost and controlled manipulation of patients’ immune system by natural products is a highly desirable goal of many clinicians due to their favorable therapeutic results and less side effects and toxicity. Therefore, mechanism of inhibition of tumor growth needs to be studied further in future. More research on the effect of RLO on immune cell subtypes and intracellular signaling events in murine models and humans is necessary to shed light on the exact mechanisms and scope of the effect of this compound. Current findings suggest that this supplement may be used in prophylaxis cases or treatment of disease in immunocompromised patients.

Figure 5. The Ras-Jun-Dmp1 pathway. Dmp1 is a key molecule linking Ras-Raf-MEK-ERK oncogenic signaling and the Arf-Mdm2-p53 tumor suppressor pathway. The pathway mediated by Dmp1 directly links oncogenic Ras-Raf signaling and p19Arf through the activation of c-Jun/JunB proteins. Oncogenic Ras activates both the Jun-Dmp1 pathway and the classical cyclin D1/Cdk4-Rb-E2F pathway in the activation of Arf gene expression in order to achieve premature senescence. Since the Ras-Raf pathway also activates the Mdm2 promoter, the levels of p53 are delicately regulated by the activity of the Dmp1-Arf and AP-1/Ets-Mdm2 pathways (6-9).

Our Proposed Future Studies and Their Significance

Many important issues concerning the roles of Ratfish oil in signal transduction and tumor suppression remain unresolved. We also need to determine the optimum dose or amount of oil for different treatments.

1. We have little information concerning Ratfish oil. What are the most relevant cancer cases that can be treated by use of Ratfish oil? What is the main mechanism that Ratfish oil suppresses the growth of human cancer cells?

2. Is tumor formation significantly reducing in Xenograft mice with human tumor cell line. How Ratfish oil treated mouse cope with its treatment?

3. Very little is known concerning the signals that activate or inhibit a selected group of oncogenes and tumor suppressors such as Ras, P53 and Dmp1 following exposure to RLO. Can Dmp1 promoter be activated by the Ratfish oil? If so, what is the mechanism? What other signals initiate from Ratfish oil that can regulate oncogenes and tumor suppressors expression.

RLO Chemical Analysis Qualitative and qualitative analysis will be performed on our RLO. It will be analyzed for unsaturated fatty acids, saturated, monounsaturated and supersaturated fats (i.e. EPA, DHA), different amino-sterols, Alkylglycerols with possible high amount, and oil or water soluble vitamins. The oil will be tested by 1-3 chemical labs, as funds permit.

What is the Fundraising Goal?

The target goal of $20,000.00 (USD) will facilitate the anti-cancer activity testing of our ratfish oils. Many of the necessary experiments are costly, specifically working with the murine model, and adequate funding is necessary. The amount of information can be gathered from these studies will be priceless. Any amount can be donated whether it be $10, $50, $100, $500, $1,000 or the entire amount. Whatever you can give will be more than welcome. And take note, the more money sent in, the more cell, molecular tests and mice model study can be done.

Who can donate?

Anyone! Fish oil and essential oil customers, company owners, medical researchers, friends, family, foes, and random people who just like to donate to fundraisers. All money will be pooled together no matter who it came from and it will be used for different stages of our study.

Is There any Perk When you are Donating?

Yes! You can involve in more ways than just by financial contribution. Donations of certain amounts can give you a specific choice of the testes you prefer to be done. The donors with bigger donation can request for specific and more important tests that are costly. Beginning with $10, there are several levels of perks and with each level, you will be able to nominate specific study that you wish to be done.

• Level 1: $10 __ You can nominate RLO from specific company that can be tested.

• Level 2: $50 — The electronic brochure of our RLO and its benefit will be send to you.

• Level 3: $100 — You can suggest specific cell and molecular study.

• Level 4: $200 — You can nominate a specific chemical company for analytical testing.

• Level 5: $300 — You are the first that will receive the results of our tests and publications.

• Level 6: $400 — You help with our mice model study and you can suggest the provider. Also you will receive a 10 ml bottle of RLO for free.

• Level 7: $500 — You will receive our electronic brochure and a 50 ml bottle of RLO for free.

When you have sent in your qualifying donation, you will receive an email within one week asking for your nominations. You can donate multiple times and extend your rewards or suggestion among multiple choices. It is your choice. The more you donate, the more choices you can make! Reminder that all who are interested to try RLO in advance can contact me and I provide you with a discount code so you can save money in your purchases.

Other Ways You Can Help

I expect that everyone who receive this message make at least $10 donation that is quite affordable. For the ones that still wish to participate further I suggest the following: please, help all of us by getting the word out. • Make some noise about this campaign.

• Share our campaign on your social media sites.

• Try the indieGoGo share tools.

• Invite your friends to contribute.

Let's see how many people we can get involved. Separately, we are weak. Together, we are strong to do many things. We have already seen a positive result from RLO in our daily life or different treatment. Come and join us! Let’s keep it going!

Let me know if you wish to try the oil, so I tell you how to obtain it.

Ali Mallakin & Bengt Svensson

2. Dosay-Akbulut M. The determination of the specific characteristics on the immunosurveilance against to cancer formation in elasmobranches. Int. J. Cancer Res. 2006;2:119–123.

3. Iannitti T, Palmieri B. An update on therapeutic role of alkylglycerols. Mar Drugs. 2010; 8(8):2267-2300

4. Anne-Laure D, Mosset P, Le Bot D, Legrand AB. Which alkylglycerols from shark liver oil have anti-tumour activities? Biochimie. 2011; 93, (1):1–3

5. Anne-Laure Deniau, Paul Mosset, Frederique Pedrono, Romain Mitre, Damien Le Bot and Alain B. Legrand. Multiple Beneficial Health Effects of Natural Alkylglycerols from Shark Liver Oil. Mar Drugs. 2010; 8(7): 2175-2184

6. Inoue K, Zindy F, Randle DH, Rehg JE, Sherr CJ. Dmp1 is haplo-insufficient for tumor suppression and modifies the frequencies of Arf and p53 mutations in Myc-induced lymphomas. Genes Dev. 2001;15:2934–9.

7. Inoue K, Fry EA. Novel Molecular Markers for Breast Cancer. Biomark Cancer. 2016 Mar 13;8:25-42.

8. Mallakin A, Sugiyama T, Taneja P, Matise LA, Frazier DP, Choudhary M, Hawkins GA, D’Agostino RB Jr, Willingham MC, Inoue K. Mutually exclusive inactivation of DMP1 and ARF/p53 in lung cancer. Cancer Cell. 2007;12:381–94.

9. Mallakin, A., Taneja, P., Matise, L.A., Willingham, M.C., and Inoue, K. Expression of Dmp1 in specific differentiated, nonproliferating cells and its repression by E2Fs. Oncogene. 2006; 25, 7703–7713.
story_txt: A Novel Energy and Immune Boosting Nutrient with Anti-Cancer and Anti-Aging ActivityTime to gather funds for extensive study and testing of the favourite and essential oil we love so much. Come join us!Background and SignificanceThe shark is a member of the Elasmobranch subclass of fish that includes the ratfish (Chimaera monstrosa). Nearly all species of sharks are known to have an extraordinary resistance to the growth of tumors and infections (1,2). Many investigations have indicated an extremely low incidence of cancer in sharks or even that no cases of cancer in sharks have been recorded (1,2). The emerging hypothesis is that n-3-polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFA) and other shark liver oil (SLO) components may exert anti-carcinogenic effects (3). SLO contains both alkylglycerols (AKG) and squalene that are anti-carcinogenic and anti-bacterial agents and have been used as an ancient remedy among the fishermen along the west coast of Norway and Sweden. It has been used for wound healing, the treatment of irritations of the respiratory and alimentary tracts and lymphadenopathy. Alkylglycerols have been in use in northern Europe for more than 50 years to assist with the prevention and treatment of cancer. They are also in widespread European use to help the immune system function more efficiently to combat infection and respiratory ailments such as asthma. New science is extending the use of this novel nutrient into the realm of anti-aging, especially for immune cells and the cardiovascular system. It has antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties and can contribute to cell membrane function in ways that help cells regulate health more efficiently – the opposite of the trend of aging.         The Chimaeras are a very primitive group of fish, with skeletons composed of cartilage instead of bone, dating back for more than 300 million years. They are true survivors from before the dinosaurs, and have changed very little since. They may actually be the oldest and most enigmatic groups of fishes alive today. The ratfish is an extraordinary fish found in all the world's oceans, close to the bottom, at depths of 300–500 meters, with a reported maximum depth of 1,663 meters. These fish are almost half shark and half ray, with smooth skin, big sparkling green eyes designed to see in the dark depths, a rabbit-like face, and a small mouth surrounded by large lips. The nose of the ratfish is studded with electric sensors able to detect the faint electrical signals given off whenever bottom dwelling prey – including crabs, snails, starfish, marine worms, urchins, clams, shrimp, and small fish – use their muscles, and sensitive enough to detect their heartbeats. Their bodies taper to an exceptionally long threadlike tail, and together with their rodent-like teeth designed for crushing the shells of their prey, has earned them the common name “ratfish.”Ratfish (Chimaera monstrosa) Distribution Distributed in Eastern Atlantic, mostly in Northern Norway and Iceland, Skagerrak and Kattegat south to Morocco including western Mediterranean (some isolated records from eastern part), Azores and Madeira Islands. Records from South Africa are questionable. Reported from Oshima, Japan.Figure 1. Whatever you can give will be more than welcome. And take note, the more money sent in, the more cell, molecular tests and mice model study can be done.Who can donate? Anyone! Fish oil and essential oil customers, company owners, medical researchers, friends, family, foes, and random people who just like to donate to fundraisers. All money will be pooled together no matter who it came from and it will be used for different stages of our study.Is There any Perk When you are Donating?Yes! You can involve in more ways than just by financial contribution. Donations of certain amounts can give you a specific choice of the testes you prefer to be done. The donors with bigger donation can request for specific and more important tests that are costly. Beginning with $10, there are several levels of perks and with each level, you will be able to nominate specific study that you wish to be done.• Level 1: $10 __ You can nominate RLO from specific company that can be tested.• Level 2: $50 — The electronic brochure of our RLO and its benefit will be send to you.• Level 3: $100 — You can suggest specific cell and molecular study.• Level 4: $200 — You can nominate a specific chemical company for analytical testing.• Level 5: $300 — You are the first that will receive the results of our tests and publications.• Level 6: $400 — You help with our mice model study and you can suggest the provider. Also you will receive a 10 ml bottle of RLO for free.• Level 7: $500 — You will receive our electronic brochure and a 50 ml bottle of RLO for free.When you have sent in your qualifying donation, you will receive an email within one week asking for your nominations. You can donate multiple times and extend your rewards or suggestion among multiple choices. It is your choice. The more you donate, the more choices you can make! Reminder that all who are interested to try RLO in advance can contact me and I provide you with a discount code so you can save money in your purchases.Other Ways You Can HelpI expect that everyone who receive this message make at least $10 donation that is quite affordable. For the ones that still wish to participate further I suggest the following: please, help all of us by getting the word out. • Make some noise about this campaign.• Share our campaign on your social media sites.• Try the indieGoGo share tools.• Invite your friends to contribute.Let's see how many people we can get involved. Separately, we are weak. Together, we are strong to do many things. We have already seen a positive result from RLO in our daily life or different treatment. Come and join us! Let’s keep it going!Let me know if you wish to try the oil, so I tell you how to obtain it.Ali Mallakin & Bengt Svensson References1. Davidson BC, Rottanburg D, Prinz W, Cliff G. story:
June 14, 2016 Before Max undergoes his surgery

"New permanent skin marks" Max is undergoing so much pain... According to him..

April 13, 2016, I was invited to attend a conference in Harvard University and It was my first time in USA. I don't have enough money and I wanted to meet local people and explore the real culture in Boston that's why I looked for a host at couchsurfing.org and everything went more than my expectation. I never felt like home just like how Max, Collins, and Chris offered to me. They offered me a free couch to stay during my stay in the USA. I am having a lot of emotional breakdowns in my life during those moments and I am so lucky to meet and have them in my life because they really became a family to me. They really made sure that I will really feel like home and that I can completely just be myself in their beautiful apartment. They even offer all the groceries and foods in their house to me and the other guests, for free! They even make coffee and cook foods for us. Drinking wine on some nights and introducing me to their friends and lots and lots of good and healthy conversations. And they do listen very well. Oops I almost forgot, they even offer their high-tech(well for me) laundry machines(yes I used it) to clean our clothes!

One of the guests during my stay with them is also from Boston, and she used  couchsurfing.org as well for the reason that she's kicked out in her apartment and have no place to sleep and no food to eat. Imagine how Chris, Max, and Collins help people with different stories? And they already hosted and helped or adopted more than 200 guests all in all. 

It was my first time to get out of Asia and USA is very different from different aspects. The culture, the technology, the advancement and so on. I never met this host(Chris, the one who owns the account in couchsurfing.org) but I didn't feel any bad vibrations or suspicions because I always trust my instincts. When I landed in Boston, Chris is not in their apartment but he gave me instructions on how to get there. After pulling my two 15kg luggages all the way to the apartment, I finally arrived at their beautiful home. I clicked the white door bell, at first I was worried if there will be someone who will open the door for me, and then here's Max, a tall, white, punk man in his 50's opened the door for me and helped me with my luggage. He showed me the room where the couch is, the kitchen, and even gave me the wifi password. He's always saying sorry because he can't accompany me and he's sick as of the moment so he needs to rest in his bedroom but he wants me to feel at home. I thought that he have some hangover from drinking but judgement is really a sin. 

During my whole stay with them, I've learned about Max's life story; I have no definite plan or itinerary in USA and I decided to stay one more night with them, and they have no problem with that. One night, we had a good wine and I can't forget that night because that's my last night of stay in their apartment and Max made my tears over flowing while he's sharing his life story and feelings, bravely. I even lost the other pair of my contact lens because of the overflowing tears that I even didn't notice that it fell out of my eye. Haha! 

I have a very tragic and worth sharing life story as well, I never heard a life story that is worst than mine. Except Max's. He's an orphan who lived in Hawaii but the family who adopted him left him behind and never heard of them again. Imagine, being an orphan is already hard because of the fact that your real parents abandoned you, what more if the family adopted you who made you believe that you will be loved, will abandon you too? It's like a double kill..   I can feel the moment he said that "I know it's hard but you have to be strong" and to live without knowing anything on your background that you don't know who you are and where you came from. Until now. And the saddest part is, he have a cancer. Yes. He have a bone cancer, a chronic myeloid leukemia. And he only have few years left, according to his doctor. Imagine you have a cancer but you don't have relatives who will care for you? It's a triple kill now. I can feel the pain when he told us that he have a cancer but he's stocked in Boston but his home is Hawaii where he can swim with the turquoise, but he have no choice but to just live and wait until the cancer gets his life. He doesn't have a relatives(of course), he's single, and he lives in an apartment with Chris and Collins, he gets money from the government because he is sick and he gives contribution for the rent and food. And in that apartment is where they adopt guests like me from all over the world. Apparently, Max wanted to travel once more after his surgery, before the cancer wont allow him to do so. But the problem is, he is stocked in the USA and he needs some funds to travel to Greece. He chose Greece, Athens, because he have some squat and friends there where he could stay. He is selling his bike and tools to fund for his trip and I really wanted to help him because I want to give back the kindness that they gave me. And I thought that crowdfunding is a great platform to share his story to the world and let's help this orphan-cancer victim to travel once more in his life! He only needs 700$ to travel to Greece, but I wanted to invite him to Philippines as well, but going to Philippines will cost  around $2000. Well, going to Philippines is not necessary but if there are many good people out there and can fund for his visit, why not! :) 

I never mention that he doesn't have a family(I mention relatives), because his family is us, his friends. And I hope you, yes you, the one who's reading this right now, will become a family to him too :) Max really have a good heart. He is really an inspiration on how to become BRAVE and STRONG. And he deserves to travel once more in his life :) He deserves to travel and touch and inspire more people's lives that he will meet along the journey. And I'm still hoping and believing that he could still fight and survive cancer.

story:
The Shelley Gautier Para-Sport Foundation is a charity named after, and inspired by Ms. Shelley Gautier. Shelley was a physiotherapist who raced mountain bikes competitively. She was on holidays in Vermont when she crashed her bike, crushing her helmet and sustaining a severe head injury. After 6 weeks in coma, she spent 8 months in a rehab hospital in Toronto learning to walk and talk again. She has hemiplegia, or one-sided paralysis, which affects the right side of her body. Shelley is now a Canadian world-class para-cyclist who is currently training to compete in the 2016 Summer Paralympic Games.

Shelley Gautier set up the foundation to help persons with disabilities partake in para-sports. Studies show that adaptive sports for PWD's provide numerous benefits including less stress, more independence, higher achievement in education and employment, reduced dependency on pain and depression medication, and fewer secondary medical conditions such as diabetes and hypertension. 

  Currently, the Foundation runs hand-cycling and tandem cycling programs in Brantford, Hamilton, Niagara and Ottawa. These programs allow for PWD's to participate in sports that they otherwise wouldn’t have access to, and has not only helped many participants physically, but also emotionally. 

The Foundation hopes to increase the number of services it provides to persons with disabilities, however there are financial restraints that currently limit the Foundation’s reach. With your help and donations, the Foundation will not only be able to maintain the hand-cycles and tandem cycles it currently has, but also add more cycles, diversify equipment and expand + add new programs. More importantly, donations will help improve the lives of numerous people with disabilities, an impact that is truly priceless. Any help, big or small, is deeply appreciated. 

Thank you so much!


Charity Number: 819134180RR0001

*To receive a donation receipt, please contact us with your full name and address.

story:
Short Summary

It is suggested that there are roughly up to 100,000,000 people around the globe infected with Borrelia Burgdorferi - the bacterial infection commonly known as Lyme disease.  Despite the rapid increase of cases, funding for Lyme disease research remains irresponsibly low.

To date there are no accurate tests for Lyme Disease - Dr.  Daniel Cameron has stated that with current testing methods as many as 50% of patients test negative for Lyme.

Helen McCormack from Flourish Partners regularly communicates with many Lyme disease advocacy groups, Lyme literate doctors and patients who have confirmed their need for an accurate diagnostic and what a difference it would make to them and those around them affected by this deadly disease.

Some comments that illustrate the impact of no accurate tests being available:-

  • "If I had received accurate testing, I would not have spent most of my teens and early twenties suffering a myriad of physical problems.  Accurate testing would have saved me from not just the physical trauma of 11 years of deteriorating health when I was supposed to be in the prime of my life, but also the emotional struggle to not lose faith in yourself when others doubt the severity or even existence of your illness".
  • "It would mean less death and pain and suffering - that's my bottom line"
  • "If there was an accurate diagnostic when I became infected, I would not have an infected child, a broken heart (literally) and lesions all over my body".
  • "An accurate and affordable test would transform the experience of the hundreds of people who visit our support group with Lyme symptoms with either negative UK tests or a refusal to test. An accurate affordable test would have the power to transform the whole landscape of Lyme. More people would be treated earlier and avoid serious disease".
  • "It would mean validation. The most crushing realization of having Lyme disease is that no one believes you. People leave you and you are left questioning yourself. It is the saddest and most unnecessary result of a Lyme diagnosis. Justification of the disease would validate thousands of people and give them confidence and hope. It would give family members a chance to feel proud of caring for a sick loved one rather than feeling ashamed and embarrassed thinking it's hypochondria. Validation of Lyme disease by accurate diagnostics would also take it to the next level of funding further research and hopefully a cure."
  • "An accurate, stable, reliable test is critical."
  • "It would be a complete game changer and mean that people could get answers to why they are suffering so much without spending a fortune and still being left in doubt with testing accuracy. It would reduce the stress that comes with not knowing what you are dealing with and the trauma of being mis-diagnosed. "

United we Heal is a crowd funding campaign that will raise funds to enable Flourish Partners to finish our urinary diagnostic test for Lyme Disease.

We're a small team committed to making a difference to the Lyme community. We need to finish the tests and validate our findings via clinical trials and quality & regulatory approval in Europe and the USA.

If we can raise funds and commercialize the tests, we can achieve the following things;

  1. Provide patients and clinicians with a direct detection method for borrelia,
  2. Provide a solution to test for Lyme disease earlier before the disease becomes chronic,
  3. Ensure the tests are cost effective and available to all globally.
  4. Provide data to generate further understanding of this disease and how it is possibly linked to other neuroimmunological diseases.
  5. Provide funding for patients via a charity to pay for their Lyme Disease diagnostics and treatments.
  6. Create further awareness, educational and research programmes for clinicians and patients on a global basis.

There are currently in excess of 25,000 fundraising campaigns for patients with Lyme disease to help them pay for their treatment, as Senator Bernie Sanders has commented, "No 'one in America should have to choose between their medicine and their food, yet millions are having to make that choice everyday". This is inexcusable and nobody on a global basis should have to make this choice.

Every single dollar donated can make a difference. For 1/3 of a price of a fancy coffee you can make a direct impact on the future of Lyme Disease. Help us to Help the Lyme Community. All donations will significantly help

What We Need & What You Get

Diagnostic development is very expensive, but there are few teams developing a test that can actually make a difference.  Any donation would be greatly received and will get us one step closer to releasing these much needed tests.

  • I can't share the exact science, but it is a method that our team have used successfully before. What is important here is that there are not many other research projects looking specifically at developing a diagnostic for Lyme disease. Also, we are using two different, yet patented methods to minimize the risk of failure and to make success more likely.
  • We are  a specialist team that have the knowledge, determination and skills to get it to the commercial market, where it can be used - there is limited risk as we have the best chance of releasing this to the market this way subject to quality and regulatory approval, which is out of our control.  As someone very wise suggested to me, even failures are ways of moving forward. We have invested heavily in this project and have the commitment and drive to make this work.
 

The Impact

As many of the Lyme disease community knows, Lyme disease is a tick borne illness caused by the bacterium Borrelia burgdorferi.

Lyme Disease is the fastest growing infectious bacterial disease in the USA.  It is twice as common as breast cancer and 6 times as common as Aids

Current Estimates of cases in the US equate to 1m new cases per year with costs the US  healthcare systems between 712m and 1.3b USD per year.  These costs do not include out of pocket expenses which are reported as being in excess of $53,000 per patient and often most families will have more than one family member affected by this deadly disease.  These costs also do not include the additional medical examinations, physician appointments and pharmaceuticals that are dispensed to patients with Lyme disease when they are misdiagnosed with other chronic illnesses such as CFS, Parkinson's AZD, and multiple sclerosis for example, causing further complications as the Lyme disease is missed, the disease becomes chronic and further damage is done.

  • Current Estimates of cases in Europe are rapidly reaching six figures, with 1.5 million cases being reported in Germany.
  • By 2020 due to climate change, 28million people will have been exposed to deer ticks, placing them at a major risk of contracting Lyme disease.
  • Richard Horowitz, a well respected Lyme medical doctor has reported that the Chinese CDC has indicated that there are 83 million cases of Lyme disease in China.
  • In Australia, the Griffin University national center for neuroimmunology and emerging disease has indicated that there are at least 460,000 cases of Lyme disease.

The impact of this disease is astounding, currently the recommended two tiered testing is not effective.

" Our development of a urinary Lyme diagnostic test in several formats will facilitate early antibiotic therapy and significantly decrease complications and costs from the Lyme disease infection on a world wide basis"

 Risks & Challenges

All scientific projects are risky, but we feel it depends upon how you view risk, it is less risky if we have an opportunity to get these tests to the market, make a difference to the medical and Lyme community, raise further awareness and importantly raise funds so that we can further directly help Lyme patients.  As a Lyme disease sufferer, how would you feel if you could ring or write to a charity and say, "here's my medical expenses" and the voice at the end of the phone says "don't worry, we'll pay those for you"  That's the intention of Flourish - if we can get the tests to market, we'll have the funds to be able to do that.

  Other Ways You Can Help

Please just share this campaign, any donation is greatly received and will help us get one step closer to helping where help is needed.

Thank you for taking the time to read this campaign.

Together we can make a difference.

As many of the Lyme disease community knows, Lyme disease is a tick borne illness caused by the bacterium Borrelia burgdorferi. 
Lyme Disease is the fastest growing infectious bacterial disease in the USA.  It is twice as common as breast cancer and 6 times as common as Aids
Current Estimates of cases in the US equate to 1m new cases per year with costs the US  healthcare systems between 712m and 1.3b USD per year.  These costs do not include out of pocket expenses which are reported as being in excess of $53,000 per patient and often most families will have more than one family member affected by this deadly disease.  These costs also do not include the additional medical examinations, physician appointments and pharmaceuticals that are dispensed to patients with Lyme disease when they are misdiagnosed with other chronic illnesses such as CFS, Parkinson's AZD, and multiple sclerosis for example, causing further complications as the Lyme disease is missed, the disease becomes chronic and further damage is done.
Current Estimates of cases in Europe are rapidly reaching six figures, with 1.5 million cases being reported in Germany.
By 2020 due to climate change, 28million people will have been exposed to deer ticks, placing them at a major risk of contracting Lyme disease.
Richard Horowitz, a well respected Lyme medical doctor has reported that the Chinese CDC has indicated that there are 83 million cases of Lyme disease in China.
In Australia, the Griffin University national center for neuroimmunology and emerging disease has indicated that there are at least 460,000 cases of Lyme disease.
The impact of this disease is astounding, currently the recommended two tiered testing is not effective.
" Our development of a urinary Lyme diagnostic test in several formats will facilitate early antibiotic therapy and significantly decrease complications and costs from the Lyme disease infection on a world wide basis" Risks & Challenges
 All scientific projects are risky, but we feel it depends upon how you view risk, it is less risky if we have an opportunity to get these tests to the market, make a difference to the medical and Lyme community, raise further awareness and importantly raise funds so that we can further directly help Lyme patients.  As a Lyme disease sufferer, how would you feel if you could ring or write to a charity and say, "here's my medical expenses" and the voice at the end of the phone says "don't worry, we'll pay those for you"  That's the intention of Flourish - if we can get the tests to market, we'll have the funds to be able to do that.  Other Ways You Can Help
 Please just share this campaign, any donation is greatly received and will help us get one step closer to helping where help is needed.
Thank you for taking the time to read this campaign.
Together we can make a difference.

story:
Short Summary

Hi. My name is Brian Abercrombie, I have been a movement and human performance specialist for more than 25 years. My partner Kristin Anderson has been a Pilates instructor for more than 20 years.

Our goal was simple. Create a system to take Machine Pilates out of the studio. Make it portable, accessible, and affordable. At the same time make sure every user has the highest level of instruction possible.

The Pilates Wheel is just the beginning of what we're offering. We bring instruction and access to some of the finest Pilates instructors anywhere and you can take them with you wherever you go, along with the Wheel, of course.

Your contribution would start us down the road to realizing a dream we have been working on for 3 years. We are excited that you will be the first to experience this unique product and we very much appreciate your interest.



What We Need & What You Get

The research, design, and testing has been done. The patents and trademarks have been secured. The tooling for manufacture is almost complete.

We are seeking $90,000 for our first production run and to help in setting up infrastructure, such as, website content, and fulfillment.

Your contribution allows you to choose from several product combinations, all geared toward giving you the experience and configuration that works best for you. From personal packages to studio packages and a few add ons, just in case you need them. Have fun!

Even if we don't reach our funding goal, production will go forward and all orders will be delivered.



The Impact

Bringing machine Pilates out of the studio and making it accessible to everyone would be an amazing thing for us. Something that required a large amount of space, and thousands of dollars, now can be done almost anywhere. Studios can increase class size, making it less expensive for the individual. Public gyms can bring machine Pilates classes into their facilities with no concerns about making room for the Yoga class in the next hour. Individuals can take it anywhere, at home or on their travels. This is the beginning of something big, and it will all start here, with you.



Risks & Challenges

There is nothing like the Pilates Wheel on the market and that means there is nothing like this on the market. Will people respond to it? Will they like it? Will they use it? 

It is our responsibility, not as inventors or business people, but as people who have spent most of their lives in the health and fitness industry, to teach people how to use it, love it, and make the Pilates Wheel an integral part of their life, health and longevity.

That's why the instruction that we include with the Pilates Wheel is as important as the product itself. We won't stop there. We will continually add instruction, tips and tools to use with your Pilates Wheel and beyond via our website and Facebook page. We are building a community.



Other Ways You Can Help

Please check out our Facebook pages. Engine Fitness and Pilates Wheel. Like us, share us with friends and contact us. We are happy to hear from you and happy to answer questions and eager to hear your feedback. Contact us at: info@enginefitness.com. Also use the Indiegogo share tools.

LET'S MAKE SOME NOISE!

story:
Thanks for your community-minded consideration in helping us fund the build-out and staffing of a first-of-its’ kind, bilingual Yoga studio with world dance and an in-house healing arts clinic for Watsonville and its’ surrounds! 

With your donation of over $50, you become a valued supporter of positive change in Watsonville, and one of our first and honored guests at the studio when we open in July, with an unlimited monthly pass! If you don't live in Watsonville, you can donate it to a designated friend or family member. 

There are at least 16 Yoga studios in Santa Cruz, Capitola, and Aptos collectively and not a single dedicated one yet in our town, amazingly. I began seeking to manifest this project in earnest last year, and have met with so much enthusiasm, synchronicity and support of all across the community, in unfolding this vision to this point. Everywhere, there is tremendous energy supporting the transformation of our downtown Watsonville area into a more visible, healthy and vibrant community for people of all ages and backgrounds.

We have gained a lease on a wonderful historic building at 375 N. Main Street, across from the beautiful community Plaza in the heart of downtown. It comes with some revitalization work to be sure, which forms part of the need-basis for this campaign: the building needs a new ADA bathroom downstairs, and new Title 24 electrical throughout the building, a $50000 price tag in addition to our other build-out, start-up and staffing costs.

Our Yoga studio, named Watsonville Yoga, Dance and Healing Arts, comes to downtown at a time ripe with anticipation and a warmly extended invitation by the City for change and progress specific to the downtown area. This change, so long in coming, could only be of the kind that reflects the unique cultural identity of Watsonville and its’ people.

I have been touched over and over by the kindness in our community, and the defining spirit that of value on the family/familia: from parents I speak to in the parks while our children play, to the gentle abuelas and abuelos who stop to interact with my children, give them treats, and touch their heads with a smile. It is because of the richness I feel here that I want to be able to give back to our community in this project, our own much needed dedicated Yoga studio and world dance studio-- with bilingual classes to connect the community inclusively to the creative, peace-of-mind-enhancing and socially uniting practices of Yoga along with the joy and cultural traditions of world dance taught by leading teachers in their art.

I have, in the past, taught bilingual Yoga classes in Watsonville and Aptos at various Mid Pen Housing sites for a largely migrant population, who I grew to know intimately. I primarily served the communities at these sites with academic tutoring, but I also orchestrated meetings with indigenous teachers for the children and adult residents of the community. I gained footing in bilingual skills thanks largely to the patience of this community of people who lovingly encouraged me. Part of the vision for this studio comes from the positive memory of the reception to those Yoga classes; how useful they were for the people doing backbreaking work in the fields, and the joy that children and young teens found in creative movement through Yoga.

Through my husband Tom May’s employment as a Science teacher at PV High and his work with youth leadership and ecology with WATCH / Monterey Bay Aquarium, I have also learned much about the needs of families in our town for healthy, culturally-grounded leadership opportunities for our youth, and the positive impact it returns to their families and to the relationship to the land which we all depend upon, live and work with as well.

I believe with all of my heart, likewise, in the capacity of Yoga to reveal the above qualities in a person. Cesar Chavez did too--he studied and took example from Yoga philosophy at the observation of “Mahatma” Mohandas K. Gandhi’s successful independence movement for India out of British colonial rule, and the improvements for the people which followed on personal and economic levels.

Watsonville Yoga, Dance and Healing Arts will both reflect the existing cultural heritages in Watsonville and continue to reach across cultures beyond our area in many ways. Yoga is steeped in it’s own culture from hereditary India, but is now practiced all over the world. The dance classes we will offer will be varied world dance taught by teachers who have lived in or studied at their artistic place of origin and are fluent in the language and indigenous musical traditions which stand beside the dance. Dance can be entertaining but has great personal value also as a cultural expression and personal means for joy, energy, discipline, and health. We have plans for "Worldanz" hip hop and global fusion for kids and adults, Middle Eastern / North African Bellydance, Brasilian Capoeira and Samba, and Ballet Folklorico, and are in the process of securing Mejica / Aztec dance and Salsa.

Yoga classes will be offered to everyone inclusively, with mostly bilingual teachers and a bilingual receptionist at the desk at all times. We will offer classes for every age, physical ability, and stylistic preference. Our staff and teachers are sought locally first.

Our tentative Yoga schedule includes classes in meditation, Iyengar-inspired Hatha Yoga, Hatha Yoga, Sivananda Yoga, Vinyasa Flow, Yin/ Restorative, Yoga for kids, and a Community by-donation class for the general public and one for Seniors.

We will also be partnering with local acupuncturists and massage therapists to have a wellness center during the low-use times in the studio.

Watsonville Yoga, Dance and Healing Arts will improve the quality of life for our community in so many ways. Be a part of the positive change and show your support by pre-purchasing a monthly pass at this discounted rate of $50 or simply making a donation! Thank you from our hearts for donating, and for helping us to by spreading the word! Please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools on this site!

story:
Why Audible Yoga

Between busy work schedules, family responsibilities and everything that life tosses at us, finding time to get to a yoga class isn't always easy. And yet, you know how a regular yoga practice ripples outward from your mat giving you greater health, more joy, and a better quality of life. 

Yoga doesn't have to stay in the studio. Your teacher can guide your practice anywhere.

Let's make a daily yoga practice CONVENIENT and POSSIBLE.

 

Why Audio Beats Video for Home Yoga Practice


What You Get from a Daily Yoga Practice

 


Audible Yoga for Every Need & Intention

Our teachers create classes to fit every need and intention for practicing:


Start a Daily Yoga Practice and All is Coming

By contributing to Audible Yoga’s crowdfund, you're on the path to creating a sustainable daily yoga practice and getting an AWESOME deal. Who doesn’t love a DEAL?

1. Choose a perk

All the perks you see here are designed to help you build a regular yoga practice no matter where you're starting from:


2. Select your yoga space

The beauty of audio yoga classes is that you can practice anywhere: at home, at work, on the road. ANYWHERE. Your partner is sleeping and you want to practice? No problem, tuck your earbuds in and enjoy a practice that's silent to them. When you travel, take your teacher's classes with you and never miss a class. At work, fit in a little stress relief with chair yoga before your next meeting.


3. Create your yoga routine

A little energy-building yoga in the morning, a meditation in the afternoon, and a restorative class in the evening - it's all here.


All Yoga Teachers Welcome

Yoga teachers around the world share their digital class recordings, virtually connect with students and earn passive income at NO COST. Through Audible Yoga, teachers are able to reach their busy, remote and traveling students. Your pledge ensures that all yoga teachers can earn a sustainable living doing what they love.

 

Yoga Teachers on Board

See just a few of the amazing yoga teachers contributing classes NOW on Audible Yoga:


 

Helping Yoga Teachers Thrive

To support our yoga teachers with yoga-business training and help them start the new year with a thriving yoga business, we worked with yoga experts to put together the ultimate yoga teacher training package:

 

 

Why We Need Your Help

We started Audible Yoga in 2015 with a device-friendly website, but we always knew we would build an app. Current subscribers are already clamoring for it and we'd like to deliver it quickly.

Our goal is to raise just $8,000

  • 100% of the funds will be used to pay for this crowdfund and app development
  • All the features of our website will be there - searching, streaming, downloading, giving feedback
  • NEW features will be implemented - notifications of new classes, save classes for later, set timers to remind you to practice, and create wish lists!
  • NEW features for teachers - tracking downloads, upload recordings from your phone, see how many students follow you.

 

Our Timeline

What People Are Saying

 

Our Story

Two inspired and dedicated women created Audible Yoga. They wanted to deliver a practical yoga product and make a difference. A yoga retreat and a simple question sparked the inspiration, “What if I could take my favorite yoga teacher home?” Soon, hundreds of international yoga teachers answered the call to record their yoga classes and give students around the world the opportunity to practice more often with their favorite teachers and even reconnect with former teachers.

 

Risks & Challenges

We have a great development team, a working business model, and the passion and drive to make this work. We have over 160 yoga teachers sharing over 1,200 yoga classes now.

We believe we're answering two very real challenges in the yoga industry today:

  • A convenient and affordable daily yoga practice for students
  • Access to passive income for yoga teachers
Our biggest risk right now is not having an app and our challenge is funding.

 

Please share - and thanks!

We hope you'll continue to support our campaign by sharing. Click the handy Indiegogo share tools at the top of the page and send this idea to your yoga teachers, studio owners, friends and family.  To share please see the tools above on the left side:
