FAQ:
How do I get Dirtea? 
Dirtea should be used to exfoliate 2-3 times per week. When starting on your course try to leave the scrub on your skin for at least 5 minutes. Ideally the longer you leave the scrub on the better it works. 
Why is green tea good for my skin?
Numerous credible independent studies show topical green tea formulations protect skin from cancer and reduce sun damage.There is well documented evidence that green tea has powerful antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties that help clear acne, inflammation, scarring and signs of aging. Green tea polyphenols are oxidized and lose their activity when exposed to air & light, so we pack our containers fresh and seal our scrub at source to help retain activity. 
Why is white tea good for my skin?
Dr. Camouse and colleagues from University Hospitals, Cleveland, Ohio, compared UV-protection effects of topical green and white tea and found them to be roughly equivalent (Experimental Dermatology, June 2009). However, there is promising data that white tea may even be the most superior rejuvenation agent - compared with 21 other plant extracts it showed the highest level of activity as an antioxidant.
Why is sweet almond oil good for my skin?
Sweet almond oil is one of the best known natural oil remedies for stretch marks. It's also packed with essential vitamins and minerals such as calcium, potassium, magnesium, vitamins E and D which are great for dry skin and dark spots too! 
Why is coconut oil good for my skin?
Coconut oil is popular for a reason. Haven't you heard? Besides being one of the best ingredients to hydrate your skin on the market it has antibacterial and antifungal properties so you don't turn into a mushroom. Seriously though, it's amazing.
Why is black tea good for my skin?
CAFFEINE! BLACK TEA IS FULL OF CAFFEINE! CAFFEINE ENERGIZES NOT JUST YOU BUT YOUR SKIN. THE BENEFITS OF BLACK TEA FOR YOUR SKIN ARE POWERFUL (THINK BETTER BLOOD CIRCULATION & LESS WRINKLY). BUT I THINK I'VE HAD A LITTLE TOO MUCH. 
Why is pink himalyan sea salt good for my skin?
If you can't take a trip to the Dead Sea then this is the next best thing. It's an ideal natural treatment for psoriasis and eczema because, for many, it has the best results compared to other therapies. It's been proven to lengthen the remission duration after weekly use. 
Is Dirtea tested on animals?
No, we have never tested on animals and we never will. However, we do test and get Dirtea ourselves on a weekly basis because it's awesome. Sometimes I feel like an animal though.
Is Dirtea vegan?
Yes, there are no animal bi-products in our scrub. 
How long before I see results?
Immediately. No we're not kidding, your skin will feel incredibly smooth right after using this scrub and a lovely scent will linger. Apply 2-3 times a week and you will see results or your money back. 
Is getting Dirtea good for sensitive skin?
Yes, try patch testing first before you rub it all over just to make sure you don't irritate your sensitive side. The majority will have no problem with this scrub but be extra gentle on your face. 
Is getting Dirtea good for oily skin?
Yes again, oil absorbs oil. Woah that's pretty darn cool. Use a body wash to rinse off any excess oil and you'll be good to go!
Is getting Dirtea good for combination skin?
Yes already! Getting Dirtea will take care of your whole body, no matter what skin type you are. There's no discrimination here. We still recommend patch testing your first application. And remember kids, don't eat anything Dirtea and don't get anything Dirtea in your eyes.
How Dirtea should I get?
As Dirtea as you want! Each container holds 7fl oz of body scrub good for an entire months worth use. 
How often should I get Dirtea?
We recommend 2-3 scrubs a week. Getting Dirtea is better in moderation.
Should I get Dirtea wet or dry?
We like damp skin - a happy medium. However if you would like a more intense treatment, Dirtea works well on dry skin too.
How long do I stay Dirtea before rinsing?
The key is to leave the scrub on for 5-10 minutes each time, this way the caffeine and antioxidants can be better absorbed into your skin.
Why is Dirtea dry?
Dirtea isn't like the other scrubs you might be used to. It's a dry scrub. If you prefer a wet scrub just add water.
Will getting Dirtea clog my drain?
Nope, the scrub is fine enough to wash down the drain. It's going to get a little messy though. It's good to get things Dirtea sometimes.
Which scrub is better?
We recommend getting the bundle if you can't decide! ;)  
What payment methods are accepted?
Visa. Mastercard. PayPal. American Express. Discover. 
How long does shipping take?
We ship USPS first class mail. Usually 3-4 days. And tracking information is provided. Worlwide shipping takes a little longer depending on customs but usually within a week. 
Will getting Dirtea stain my skin?
No. Your skin may look a little green or brown while you use it but the color will wash off right away. That fresh mint, coconut, or lemon scent (whichever scrub you choose) will linger.
What if I get Dirtea in my eyes?
Wash it out babe. Keep this scrub out of your eyes. If this occurs rinse thoroughly. If irritation occurs, discontinue use and seek medical assistance. Unlikely so hey, stay positive. 
Can I get Dirtea on my face?
If you have sensitive skin, be gentle. Dirtea can be a coarse exfoliator for some and the skin on your face is delicate. If you want to use it on your face, test first, and use a soap free cleanser to wash off any excess oil.
I'm pregnant, can I still get Dirtea?
Hey beautiful mamma to be. As much as we want to get Dirtea with you, we recommend you consult your doctor before you start using our scrub. Dirtea does have a high caffeine content as well as peppermint oil, so some ladies choose to wait and use Dirtea after they have their babe. However, if you are still drinking tea/coffee it shouldn't be an issue.
How long will getting Dirtea last?
Dirtea scrubs have a shelf life of nine months. 
Please SHARE :) 
If you cannot contribute right now you can still help us tremendously by sharing this campaign using the icons on the top left of this page. So please feel free to share the link to this project in emails or messages. Show your friends, tell your colleagues, post about us on Facebook, Tweet about the project - it would truly mean the world to me and the team! Thank you <3 
TEAM INTRO:
April Schuppel - Manufacturing Engineer 


Taylor Melchionna - Production Consultant  


Jon Sweet - Independent Data Analyst 





And of course, the team wouldn't be complete without all the friends and family that have helped us along the way. We love you!
OUR PRODUCTS ARE SAFE FOR ALL AGES & ALL SKIN TYPES
Be sure to ask your doctor before using our products if you are pregnant. 
HYPOALLERGENIC: contains no yeast, dairy, egg, gluten, corn, soy, or wheat.
Contains no starch, preservatives, artificial color, flavor, or fragrance. 
Disclaimer: The vast majority Dirtea users won't feel any side effects from our ingredients. But, since humans come in many different skin types we cannot guarantee that EVERYONE on planet earth will have a positive experience. If you do sense any ill side effects, then don't worry they’re not life threatening and you can stop getting Dirtea immediately. We offer a 30 day money back guarantee if you don't absolutely love your skin. Statements contained herein have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent any disease. 
Investors interested in further agricultural/infrastructural development please email: hello@getdirtea.com * Future plans to farm our own tea and grow our own herbs (for essential oils). 
XO

WWW.INSTAGRAM.COM/GETDIRTEA

story:
Mason was born on January 22nd, 2013. He is our second born son and has the proudest big brother Tanner who is 7 years of age. Mason appeared to be like any other healthy 37 week newborn and we brought him home full of joy. Within 6 days of being home Mason had to go to the ER, which was the first of many visits.

  Countless doctors’ visits, ER visits, hospitalizations, IV antibiotics, Spinal taps, injections of strong antibiotics week after week, the strongest oral antibiotics possible because others just wouldn’t work. Numerous specialists , and lots of blood work but still no answers. We knew this was not normal and something was wrong with our baby. Chronic cough, asthma, reflux, small seizures, low muscle tone, and ventral hernia (that may need to be repaired), his spleen has been enlarged for over a year now, the list seems to keep growing.

  In December 2013 Mason was diagnosed with a genetic primary immune deficiency (PID) called MBL deficiency. He was started on prophylactic antibiotics twice a day long term and will need to have his ear tubes replaced soon to try to cut back on respiratory and ear infections, in hopes of lessening the harsh antibiotics. As time went on, he continued to get very sick, infections still overlapping one another and the doctors continued to fight to get us answers. It seemed as if the respiratory stuff improved slightly but that he appeared to be getting viruses that were going into bacterial infections.

  In December of 2014, exactly a year later, they found he was born with another very rare PID called Natural Killer (NK) Cell Deficiency, which makes him vulnerable to potentially fatal infections and cancer. Dr. Orange, an immunologist and researcher at Texas Children's Hospital, estimates that around 75 people worldwide have a true NK cell deficiency. Currently, there is no specific treatment, but the treatment focuses to cure infections associated with the disorder.  Mason cannot receive live vaccines. No varicella or MMR vaccines, if he ever received the vaccines they could be fatal to him as he could contract the illness. He relies on herd immunity for protection.

  Mason was started on antivirals three times a day, to try to prevent certain types of viral infections that could cause  causing serious lifelong problems. If he does contract specific viruses, such as herpes type viruses (chicken pox, cmv, hsv) or mono for example, he may not be able to fight them off.  Antivirals do not protect against all viruses and that is why mason has recurrent viral infections. His cells ignore the virus instead of fighting like they should. Any time Mason has a fever for several days, we have to run blood tests to make sure the virus has not gone into the blood stream. Antivirals are beneficial but can cause anemia since he’s on prophylactic antibiotics as well, which requires frequent labs, but that is something he is, unfortunately, used too.

  NK cells are produced in the bone marrow. His doctors said this deficiency could be an underlying sign of a much more serious immune disorder. Each test is a few thousand dollars and we are responsible for 20% of that cost for each test ran. Depending on the genetic results, the treatment could be bone marrow or stem cell transplant, or there could be no cure at all. So you can see how important it is, that we get answers, or rule out some of the bad stuff at least. We are also working with the Immune deficiency foundation, to get more researchers interested, to fight for a cure.

  Dr. Orange has reviewed Mason’s labs and wants to see him, he said he feels like he can help Mason. Our first appointment is August 31st so we are flying out to Texas Childrens Hospital. Mason will be entered into his research program and have  full exome sequencing studies done to try to find the gene that has caused his NK cell deficiency. As of now, insurance has denied everything including any testing he wants done before we go out there, but we are hopeful that it will be covered. Genetic testing is very expensive. This one test alone, that has been ordered and denied by our insurance so far, is around $20,000. If insurance does not help, it will limit what studies we can do. We have been told wonderful things about Dr. Orange and that he is definitely who we need to see, if we have any chance at answers it will be through him. . Tanner will also have to be tested for NK cell deficiency since it is genetic. He gets well like a normal child but he does get really sick when he catches things, we were told he could be a carrier. We are thankful to have a great doctor that wants to help.

Mason has a great team of doctors, near and far, that really care about him, and want the same as we do, for him to be healthy. As his parents, we see him up at night coughing until he throws up, sleeping more than usual or not touching his food. What others see is a wild playful little boy who loves life to the fullest and we would not have it any other way. We are thankful he can enjoy life, things could always be worse. Mason catches everything, so we have to be very careful. Unfortunately with both of us working full time to carry insurance and make ends meet, Mason has to go to daycare 1-2 days a week sometimes and that's a nightmare as you can tell. We have been told he should not be in daycare at all. But it is not an option. We’ve tried a homecare, but with big brother in school, the illnesses were still brought home; tried isolating him or making him wear a mask when out in public, but he was still sick. Family has been wonderful in taking him when they can, but it only takes one day for him to catch something.

  We both work full time, and we work hard. We never wanted to make a site for help with Masons medical costs, but family and friends are asking us to, so they can offer to help. We are trying not to see it as a sign of weakness, but it’s for our son, he deserves it! With an ongoing illness its hard balancing work and normal, everyday bills with the high medical bills for the last 2 and a half years. The boys truly deserve a some what normal life like other children, they are the sweetest boys, with the biggest hearts.

  We were able to raise $2300 with a benefit with the help of family, friends and the community, and we feel so blessed and so beyond thankful to each and every person! Unfortunately as you can tell, that is only a fraction of the costs already accumulated. Any money raised will be put in an account specifically for Mason to help with ongoing medical expenses: for travel/gas to his multiple specialist appointments , each doctor is  1.5 to 3 hours away, medications (his inhalers are $110), surgeries a minimum of $900, genetic testing, hospital stays around $400, ER visits $150, labs, xrays, etc., missed work for when he's ill, and the initial Texas trips costing around $20,000 because of testing that is needed and future trips for follow up care, plane tickets are $700 plus hotel cost, food, and rental car. We are hopeful that we will get to stay at Ronald McDonald house but we will not know until the day of arrival.

We appreciate everything, Prayers, or spreading the word to help raise awareness, is a huge blessing for our sweet Mason. Thank you, to all of you from the bottom of our hearts.

Thank you for the continued prayers and any help provided! God Bless,

  The Cobb Family

  For updates on Mason follow him on facebook : A joyful heart is the best medicine

story:
The

The PrideR is a gift of life providing mobility to many seniors (baby boomers) and others unable to walk long distance. Many feel self-conscious about using wheelchairs (by lose of pride or because of public stigma. Now they can:

                           

The PrideR is the world’s only “standing only, slow moving (safer) patented scooter” with two (2) lightweight parts under 20 Lbs. It can be disassembled and put in a car trunk in seconds. It  resolves medical walking issues (e.g. lungs heart, joints), and provides mobility:

a: Ability to get around in any environment, including malls, airports ,hotels, etc., and                                                                                                                                                            b. Ability to drive the PrideR anywhere by easily putting it in the car trunk.

The PrideR  Complies with TSA, Airports and Airlines Rules & Regulations, and  Is Allowed Anywhere.

     

                     

                                                  Joseph Tsiyoni 

                                                                        

Only in the U.S. can a new immigrant who comes from a family of 12 living in one bedroom, who arrived with only a 300-word vocabulary, ending up as an executive, inventor, entrepreneur and author of 16 books.

Executive Positions: IRS H.R. Director (IS), federal Chief Auditor and AZ largest County’s 1st Auditor.  Among his many inventions is a new Online Gradual Price Reduction System patent for goods & services – which may make the eBay auction system obsolete. 

As the inventor and the first user, he is now on a mission to provide the PrideR to persons who can stand and drive a scoter - who otherwise must use wheelchairs.

wheelchairs (by lose of pride or because of public stigma. Now they can:

scooter” with two (2) lightweight parts
under 20 Lbs. It can be disassembled and put in a car trunk in seconds. It 
resolves medical walking issues (e.g. lungs heart, joints), and provides mobility:

a: Ability to get around in any environment, including
malls, airports ,hotels, etc.,
and                                                                                                                                                            b. Ability to drive the PrideR anywhere by easily putting it
in the car trunk.


The
PrideR  Complies with TSA, Airports 
and Airlines Rules & Regulations, and  Is Allowed Anywhere.
                                                                              Joseph Tsiyoni

in the U.S. can a new immigrant who comes from a family of 12 living in one
bedroom, who arrived with only a 300-word vocabulary, ending up as an executive,

story:
ASD Prati 2000 è una storica Società di Pallavolo femminile, nata a Roma nel 1996 ed oggi attiva a Sacrofano, alle porte della città.

Una Società ed un gruppo di ragazze e bambine appassionate e vincenti: nell'ultima Stagione infatti la nostra Prima Squadra - l'Invincibile! - ha ottenuto l'incredibile Record di vincere tutte le partite del Campionato, accedendo così alla Serie D, mentre le bambine e ragazze delle altre Categorie si classificavano tutte nei primi posti dei rispettivi Campionati.

Ma la nostra più grande soddisfazione è di riuscire a dare alle nostre 60 tesserate - piccole e grandi - una Passione che le aiuti a crescere all'insegna di valori sani.


L'incredibile risultato delle "Invincibili" della Prima Squadra e delle altre ragazze è stato raggiunto in condizioni a dir poco difficili.

Ci alleniamo infatti  in una palestra fatiscente, priva di ogni requisito minimo, con le pareti a 20 centimentri dalle linee di bordo campo ed il soffitto poco più alto della rete e senza acqua calda per le docce.

Per giocare le partite dei vari Campionati, abbiamo dovuto affittare il campo di Castelnuovo campi (a oltre 15 km di distanza), essendo appunto il nostro campo non regolamentare.

Nonostante queste difficoltà abbiamo combattutto tutte insieme e abbiamo vinto (o quasi) tutti i nostri tornei !

Ma da questa stagione, le cose si complicano!

Il Comune di Sacrofano aumenterà il Canone di Affitto della Palestra (non a norma!) in cui ci alleniamo e - per le partite -  il campo di Castelnuovo non sarà più disponibile.

Inoltre le nuove norme impongono, giustamente, la dotazione di un defibrillatore anche nei campi di allenamento e senza questo non potremo più nemmeno allenarci.

Cosi rischiamo di smettere! Tutte e 60, sia le grandi che le piccole 

E di interrompere il sano sogno delle Invincibili di giocare in Serie D e di togliere alle 60 ragazze e bambine delle altre Categorie la loro passione.

Ma noi vogliamo combattere tutto questo sul campo, come siamo abituate a fare!

E' per questo che chiediamo il vostro supporto.


Il nostro obiettivo è di permettere che la ASD Prati2000 continui ad esistere, nonostante tutto.

E' di permettere all'Invincibile, la nostra grande Prima Squadra di vincerle ancora tutte, anche in Serie D.

E' di permettere alle ragazze e bambine delle Categorie inferiori di migliorarsi ancora e provare anche loro ad imitare le Invincibili.

E' di permettere alle nostre 60 tesserate di continuare a fare con entusiasmo e passione il loro Sport preferito, invece di passare i loro pomeriggi "sul muretto".


Per permettere alle nostre bambine e ragazze di continuare a primeggiare nei rispettivi Campionati e a pensare che i grandi credano nell'esempio dello Sport e nei suoi valori e stili di vita sani, abbiamo bisogno di poche fondamentali cose, il cui costo complessivo è di circa 11.600€:

Il Canone di affitto della Palestra che il Comune di Sacrofano ci mette a disposizione per gli allenamenti ed i costi di manutenzione: circa 2.900€

L'affitto del Campo PalaLUISS di Roma, dove dovremo giocare le partite in Serie D della Prima Squadra: circa 1.400€

L'affitto del Campo per poter giocare le partite dei Campionati delle Under 13 e Under 14: circa 1.200€

Un Defibrillatore e relativi corsi di formazione, obbligatori per legge da quest'anno anche durante gli allenamenti: circa 1.500 €

L'Acqua Calda per le docce: Caldaia + Installazione, e ripristino dell'impianto idraulico: circa 1.800 €

Le risorse per dotare tutte le ragazze e bambine di Materiale Tecnico adeguato - fino ad oggi la retta permetteva di fornire solo le magliette - ovvero tuta, borse, magliette, pantaloncini, sostituzione palloni da allenamento e rete: circa 2.800 €


Obiettivo e Impiego dei Finanziamenti ulteriori

Il nostro sogno è di regalare alle nostre bambine e ragazze una normalità speciale.

Ecco perchè abbiamo già molto chiari gli impieghi dei fondi che raccoglieremo oltre l'obiettivo di 11.600€

Con la raccolta ulteriore rispetto a 11.600€, creeremo un Fondo Vincolato per la realizzazione del Nuovo Palazzetto Sportivo presso il Comune di Sacrofano, per il quale esiste già sia il terreno che il Progetto Esecutivo, ma mancano del tutto i fondi necessari per la realizzazione.

Ci piace darci obiettivi ambiziosi e raggiungerli: per questo sogniamo di arrivare a 150.000€, per raccogliere i fondi necessari per creare - nel nostro Comune - una sportiva adeguata e utile per tutti gli Sport e la nostra Comunità, in particolare per aprire le porte del nostro Sport anche ai Diversamente Abili e alla Terza Età.

Per realizzare NOI quello che dovrebbero fare gli ALTRI


Chi aiuterà SCHIACCIA! potrà dimostrare insieme a noi che - anche quando mancano le cose essenziali - si può raggiungere l'obiettivo di aiutare un gruppo di ragazze e bambine a realizzare il proprio sano sogno

Noi in cambio abbiamo pensato di ricompensarvi con qualcosa che possa ricordare per sempre questo gesto e che possa permettere ai nostri donatori di mostrare a tutti che sono stati protagonisti di una storia bella e vincente

Sulla destra di questa pagina - sotto alla scritta "SELECT A PERK" - trovi descritti incolonna i vari modi in cui ti mostreremo la nostra riconoscenza per il contributo - piccolo o grande - che vorrai dare

Scegli alcuni dei nostri SUPER PERKS!!


Come donare

Donare è semplicissimo e sicuro

Basta avere una Carta di Credito oppure un conto PayPal e cliccare sul bottone viola che trovi in alto a destra di questa pagina con scritto "CONTRIBUTE NOW"

A quel punto verrai indirizzato a una Pagina con 3 Sezioni:

1. CONTRIBUTE, dove scegliere quanto donare e fornire l'indirizzo per ottenere il Riconoscimento corrispondente

2. PAY, dove fornire i dati della Carta di Credito o del Conto PayPal per contribuire. Ricorda: se scegli di contribuire con la Carta di Credito devi comunque cliccare su "GO TO PAYPAL" e solo dopo inserire i dati della Carta

3. SHARE, per condividere con tutti i tuoi amici o conoscenti di Facebook, Twitter e Youtube il progetto ed aiutarci a raggiungere l'obiettivo

Per chi volesse un aiuto, basta guardare il semplice video dimostrativo cliccando sul link qui di seguito:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=prvHWaG4JL8

Puoi aiutarci anche...

Condividendo su facebook il progetto e invitando tutti i tuoi amici a fare lo stesso

Diventando follower su Twitter di #SCHIACCIA!

Raccontando a tutte le persone che conosci, chi siamo e cosa vogliamo fare...


AIUTACI A REALIZZARE IL NOSTRO SOGNO !
NE FARAI PARTE PER SEMPRE

story:
Hello ! My name is Evelina Stefania Dicu from Galati, Romania, I have just turned 14 months and I was diagnosed with a rare genetic disorder - cystic fibrosis .

             The money that will be collected will help me to carry on the treatments and all the tests that I need to overcome this disease.

             What can I do until I am 6 years old?

             I am recommended by my doctor to go for physiotherapy techniques,  respiratory clearance exercises and inhalation therapy. The inhalation therapy can only be done abroad ( England, France, Scotland) as we do not have specialists dealing with this type of disease. My diet includes a specific milk formula, fats, vitamins, specific to my disease, which are not very cheap.

         I must regularly monitor my body condition by doing investigation  and tests within the private system. The doctor says I will need a physiotherapy vest for my lungs to work properly which cost about $ 10,000. This vest is an airway clearing device used to reduce pulmonary complications.

   I am confident that with lots of care and attention from my parents and relatives I will be able to grow up to benefit from this treatment and I hope that, by then my parents to raise money for it.

              I would like to thank you for supporting me !

             Cystic fibrosis is a disease where at cellular level an essential protein that regulates intra and extracellular fluids, is missing. In the absence of this protein the liquids become poor in water, adherent and sticky. At digestive level the mucus is obstructing the pancreatic tubes so the pancreatic enzymes are no longer emptied in the duodenum. They stick to the lungs causing a productive cough and risk of repeated lung infections.

             Currently, the average age of survival is about 40 years, but these statistics were done when there was no chronic treatment and the only solution to patients were medication that relieve symptoms and which failed to reduce the associated complications. That's why, unfortunately the body gives up in a few decades.

             After nearly 20 years of development and research in the US, in 2012 the Vertex laboratory produced the first treatment for a different type of cystic fibrosis. Earlier this year up to autumn will take place the testing of Phase III of my type of illness treatment. Following this testing, the treatment will be marketed starting with next year. So far this study is addressing to children over 6 years old. My treatment is very expensive, about $ 30,000 per month !! Being a chronic treatment should be given a lifetime like a treatment for high blood pressure.

story:
Who we are?

We are people, who like cleanliness. That's why we think that all of our supporters will want to have a such device which can help you to  get rid of bacteria.


Our dangerous neighbours - bacteria

  Did you know that every 60 seconds, a worker comes into contact with more than 30 objects that may be contaminated with bacteria or viruses that cause infectious diseases? According to the latest studies it was found that the surface of a desktop, computer keyboards, a mouse, or telephone handset are the main carriers of harmful bacteria, because people touch them more often. They are in fact more polluted than the toilet seat in the bathroom.
  London scientists scanned 33 keyboards and revealed that four of them are a potential health hazard, while one had five times as many germs as a toilet seat in the bathroom of the same institution. During the tests, which were conducted in January, one of the experts participating in the study, sent a keyboard selected at random, for analysis. It was found that the number of bacteria on it exceeds the maximum acceptable limit by 150 times. Researchers say that the cause of this state of the keyboard is that people often eat while working on their computer and bits of food fall in between the keys, which then become infested with microbes. Another reason is the failure to comply with the elementary rules of hygiene, in particular, the need to wash your hands after using the toilet.



But how can you protect yourself from this attack of microbes? Is it possible to get rid of these dangerous creatures?

Now there is a solution, its called «BakterKiller». BakterKiller - is a unique device that kills 99.9% more bacteria, can you imagine?! Now there is no need to worry while working on your computer or using the phone or even public doorknobs – now you can get rid of these dangerous bacteria that destroy one’s health and general wellbeing. There is no need now to worry that when your child goes to the computer to look for a cartoon, he or she will start sneezing from allergies. Now there is no need to be concerned that some virus or bacteria will impact your health and cause some diseases. 



What you can do with BakterKiller and how it is useful:

• Suitable for households, travel, business, healthcare industries. It's easy to bring and use.

• Ultraviolet light helps to eliminate bacteria, viruses, fungus, mold, etc, on the surfaces of most household and personal items. Remove doors, bacteria, and dust mites which cause splenitis, pneumonia, asthma, and allegies.

• Maintain room and cupboard cleanliness, with household products to keep thingsclean, and so avoid the growth of bacteria.


• Portable clamshell design: space saving, to sterilize the required area at any time.

• Simple operation easy to press power button.

• With protection (safety switch), it will automatically turn the UV-C light off if the device is turned upward.

• Products used in daily life, such as chopsticks, spoons, dishes, telephone handsets, desk, toilets, public places, doorknobs, automobiles, etc, - be sure to keep them all free from harmful bacterial pathogens. Keep your rooms, closets and household appliances in a “Germ Free” healthy environment.


• Powered either by Micro USB cable or 4 triple A batteries. It's safe and energy-efficient.


Specification:

• Size: L125 x W35 x H25 mm.

• Weight: 65g.

• UV-C Lamp: 2W Lamp. Life:20000hrs

• UV Wavelength: UV-C (253.7nm).

• Battery: 4x AAA/6V or USB cable.

• Color: Customized clolor.





• Printed circuit board with chip BakterKiller.

• Installation BakterKiller.

• UV lamp BakterKiller.


Risks and challenges

We are ready to solve all possible problems . When failure of the device , it can be replaced free of charge for six months.

  As you can see, this product is a breakthrough in modern technology. Do you want to breathe freely and be in good health; do you want to forget about viruses bacteria and the resultant diseases, - there is no need to be afraid of your environment – simply use BakterKiller – its all you will ever need!!!


                                        TIMELINE


Set of batteries as a gift for the first 100 customers. Hurry up



CONTACT 

If you have questions during or after the campaigns have closed or questions related to the Indiegogo Campaign, you can always reach us at 
Email : bakterkiller@gmail.com . We receive a lot of special requests, and respond as fast as possible!
For press inquiries please contact Email : dennyredkin@facebook.com
story_txt:
Who we are?We are people, who like cleanliness. That's why we think that all of our supporters will want to have a such device which can help you to  get rid of bacteria.










  Our dangerous neighbours - bacteria
  Did you know that every 60 seconds, a worker comes into contact with 
more than 30 objects that may be contaminated with bacteria or viruses 
that cause infectious diseases?
According to the latest studies it was found that the surface of a 
desktop, computer keyboards, a mouse, or  telephone handset are the main
 carriers of harmful bacteria, because people touch them more often.  
They are in fact more polluted than the toilet seat in the bathroom.   London scientists scanned 33 keyboards and revealed that four of them 
are a potential health hazard, while  one had five times as many germs 
as a toilet seat in the bathroom of the same institution.
During the tests, which were conducted in January, one of the experts 
participating in the study,  sent a keyboard selected at random,  for 
analysis.
It was found that the number of bacteria on it exceeds the maximum 
acceptable limit by 150 times.
Researchers say that the cause of this state of the keyboard is that 
people often eat while working on their computer and bits of food fall 
in between the keys, which then become infested with microbes.
Another reason is the failure to comply with the elementary rules of 
hygiene, in particular, the need to wash  your hands after using the 
toilet.

story:
Art is about responsibility. Violence is caused by suppression. The crucial life supporting elements that are damaged belong to the person or are located in his or her environment. This project identifies and seeks to cure the causes of violence worldwide. 


When suppression desensitizes culture to violence, popular perception becomes skewed and focuses on those aspects that elicit grief and fear. This is covert violence that makes us commit heinous acts, whether towards others or towards ourselves. On the surface, unproductive haywire passions and lack of insight and control do not appear all that bad. However, when considered in their public manifestations, they are part of suppressive campaigns that use force to achieve damaging ends. Failure of gun control regulations, open ended conflict in the Middle East, and illegal immigration are just a few examples. A desensitized culture renders us unable to confront the problem. This project supports a healthy civic order by uncovering and identifying causes of violence as they relate to what matters most to our cultural and national identity: national security, immigration, and foreign relations, to name a few. Please visit our project page for more details. 


Project collaborators have first hand experience with the political and social problems that mask root causes. ISIS, to provide just one example, is not just a bunch of weirdos but, unacceptably, an organized group that has pushed through a highly specific vision and political agenda. It takes a specific technology to break down a culture to the extent that it is willing to absorb destructive and sickening news story after news story, none of which contributes to a real understanding of the problem. 


Project contributors have the unique opportunity to correct and set straight a lack of information, or an abundance of false information, that thwarts popular perception and confuses the virtues of liberalism with the dead-end self-indulgence of violence. Yet once causes are identified, it does not take much to help everyone live in a world that is safer and more secure. Getting there however does take much, given the abundance of disinformation, and it is here that your support is required.


We need your contribution in order to fund the basic operations of this public policy and publication platform.  

WHERE DO THE FUNDS GO (a year) ?

Please note that these are the basic minimum lowest amounts.
Office space and computer                            $5,000.00
Book production costs                                     $3,000.00
Indiegogo platform and payment fees        $4,000.00
Advertising fees                                                  $5,500.00
Other advocacy publications printing, 
copying, distribution costs                             $4,000.00
Basic salary for a full-time writer,
researcher, event coordinator, and
public relations person                                 $28,500.00
                                                                              $50,000.00 TOTAL   

For just $150 a year, or a paltry $12.50 a  month, you will get all publications and updates produced in that year. By comparison, the satisfaction from having contributed to making the world a safer and more secure place is tremendous.  


We are not playing games or making false promises. The real and accurate information to set the record straight when violence threatens to get the better part of our culture is out there; it is just a matter of doing the (considerable) work of identifying and assembling it, which is the vision and goal of the project creators.

A healthy civic order knows no borders. The freedom of conscience on which it is based is foundational to several modern Constitutions, in particular in countries, importantly beginning with the United States in 1788, in which freedom of religion has played a crucial founding role. Today, religious extremism magnifies the importance of protecting the fragile freedom of conscience on which the civic order is based. The paid professional scam artists that don the guise of religion in the Middle East and Africa are puppets that further high level hidden and corrupt political interests. Religious extremism eradicates the democratic process at its very root. Our goal is to eradicate religious extremism forever. Please visit our international page for more information. 

We are available 24/7 to receive your comments and feedback, to answer questions, and to discuss any experience or story you have that you would like to include in a publication or have disseminated. Just email us at info@immigrationequity.com . 

Why are "we" listed as only 1 team member ? The vast majority of our past contributors are associated with political organizations that have the requirement to vet a project before endorsing it. This takes significant time and is not necessary at the present point of our project.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ema. I live in London, I have a deep seated passion to help those in need. To this end I have done voluntary work for charities. Particularly those with a focus on children in need.

On this occasion, this appeal cuts very close to home because Zara is my niece. She is the last child of four children.

She is a happy gregarious child. A trait she inherited from her mother; and like every other child her age, she is active and loves to play. Unfortunately she walks and runs with great difficulty and with much pain due to the bow shape of her legs.

Her mother died immediately after her birth, leaving her care and upbringing in the hands of her aged grandparents. Her father is unskilled and for the most part is out and about sourcing for menial labour. They live in the coast town of Warri in the Nigerian Niger Delta.

Watching Zara walk is heartbreaking, and when she can no longer walk because of the pain, she cries to be carried. As most would probably already know, children can be infamous for their savagery, meaning that Zara has to put up with the bullying and cruel taunts of other children at school and in the neighbourhood. 


What We Need 

She is still very young and there is still time to reverse the psychological damage. Fortunately, there is a procedure for the correction of bowed legs that has gained wide acceptance as a treatment option for younger children, called high tibial osteotomy (HTO) Very simply, one bone in the tibia is cut and the leg is  re-aligned by an orthopedic surgeon.

For Zara, this surgery will be done at the  “University of Port Harcourt Teaching Hospital,” one of the best Orthopaedic hospitals in the southern part of Nigeria. She would also be close to family. Besides, it would be more convenient to commute from her home to the hospital, especially during the recovery period projected at between six to ten weeks.

We estimate that the period of treatment will incur a total cost of £6500. Anything you can do to help us raise the funds for her surgery would be appreciated in no small measure.


Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't donate. Spreading the word through social media and personal contacts is just as invaluable. We greatly appreciate your help and the difference it will make to Zara and the family. Thank you so very much!

story:
Finally a device designed and made for people with a challenged immune system or a respiration problem such as asthma, Copd, cronic bronchitis and others . You can use this device in situations of a confined air space  shared with others such as an airplane, train, bus, car and even the doctor’s waiting room. The device can protect you or others from you at times when you may have a respiratory illness.

The device is a self-adjusting face mask with a patent applied no-leak soft bladder which solves the major problem of face masks, leakage around the edges. The situation is so bad that people who use face masks in the work regimen must undergo an expensive and time consuming fit- test yearly to check and try to correct these leakages. With this mask the user can conveniently self adjust. insuring no leakage and adequate  operation. When fully exploited and in volume production this mask will protect from airborne bacterial and viral pathogens and sell for slightly under $20. We are asking for help in expediting this development.

Respirators are commonly used for protection against TB, influenza, bacteria,  and other airborne pathogens.  There are over 5 million Medical, Industrial, EMS and similar users of conventional respirators in the US. Approximately 50 million Americans suffer from asthma, COPD, chronic bronchitis, or emphysema.  These people represent a high risk category for infection from airborne pathogens and they are often unable to effectively fight the ensuing distress.The Institute of Medicine has reported that the largest problem with these devices is face seal leakage. ProReactive LLC of Lansing, MI has developed a patent pending respirator which virtually eliminates this critical issue through an adjustable, inflatable face seal bladder system.

The ProReactive respirator further protects users by integrating state of the art nano-filtration media which allow for previously unobtainable protection from airborne pathogens such as H1N1, Avian, Swine flu and other viruses.

This new technology has the added benefit of potentially reducing or eliminating costly mandatory workplace respirator fit testing. The low cost replaceable filter  and the application of disinfectants on the re-usable face mask body will substantially reduce the ongoing expense and provide improved  protection for employees. (For single person use) These cost reductions will greatly aid in the preparation for future pandemics by healthcare facility, EMS, public safety department or similar organization.

 

WE NEED YOUR HELP

Our goal is to raise funding to start producing this innovative item in Michigan and Ohio. This product is revolutionary, reusable and the lack of face mask leakage will make this one of the most effective products on the market. You can join in on the ground floor and be a part of this novel product that will not contribute to the millions of masks that are filling up landfills every day. Our disposable filter housings can be made of a bio-starch that is 99% biodegradable and will contribute little to these crowded landfills.



The Team:

Alex Walacavage-Inventor
Dr. Jack Holland  -Advisor, Professor Emeritus MSU
Dr. Kerry by Fannin- Advisor, Environmental Science
Mark Kellog- Legal Rep, Juris Doctorate
Aaron Jenkins-Communications Director
John Brandenburg-Media Director


PROJECT SUMMARY

 Respirators are commonly used for protection against TB, Influenza, Bacteria, SARS and other airborne pathogens.  There are over 5.1 million Medical, Industrial, EMS and similar users of conventional respirators in the US.  Since the largest problem with these devices is face seal leakage. ProReactive LLC of Lansing, Mi has developed a patent pending respirator which virtually eliminates this critical issue through an inflated face seal bladder system.

The ProReactive respirator further protects users by integrating state of the art nano-filtration media which allows for previously unobtainable protection from airborne pathogens such as H1N1, Avian and the Swine flu virus.

This new technology has the added benefit of potentially reducing or eliminating costly mandatory workplace respirator fit testing. The low cost replaceable filter and the application of disinfectant procedures on the re-usable face mask housing will substantially reduce the ongoing expense  and provide levels of improved protection for employees and the general public. Additionally, the multiple use of the Proreactive mask by a single user will reduce the cost to healthcare facility, EMS, public safety departments, or similar organizations in preparation for a pandemic.
              



MARKET ANALYSIS

Research has shown the following market statistics:

Over five million American workers are required to wear respirators to protect themselves from hazards in their workplace. The current market for a popular N95 respirator (typically disposable) of the type in contrast to the ProReactive face mask in the United States is at 900 million units annually, the majority of which are used in a non-medical setting. The Department of Health and Human Services is intent on both stockpiling as well as increasing the production of N95 respirators.  The United States would reportedly need approximately 5.3 billion disposable respirators during a pandemic situation, only 0.2 percent of which is currently available. There are regulatory bodies governing the devices in the target markets and these agencies have spent considerable effort driving improved product performance with workshops on design improvements for fit testing, user comfort enhancement, and filtration media optimization.  Fit testing is a required annual process that assures that a given respirator fits the individual user.  Although fit testing costs hospitals and others millions of dollars each year in man-hours, equipment, and training, it is still mandated due to conventional product leakage and is critical to protecting the user. 


The Institute of Medicine states what the design drivers for effective PPE are, and the ProReactive product exceeds these drivers by providing the following factors:

  • Improved protection due to face seal leakage elimination, and using new technology filter material
  • The Proreactive face mask will have the ability for the user to do their own fit test ( See Video)
  • Improved user comfort due to inflatable seal system
  • Reduction in cost due to fit testing elimination 
  • Improved compliance with worker health regulations due to dramatically improved protection from airborne pathogens and other pollutants.
  • The ability to cool or heat the Proreactive face mask depending on the users needs
  • The first phase proreactive face mask's will be made of clear virgin polymers so that the users face will be visible to patients and others

Healthcare Market:

  • Healthcare is one of the fastest growing markets in the World and will be on the front lines delivering care and reducing the spread of any future epidemics and pandemics
  • Currently, there are over 7,500 US hospitals employing more than 5.1 million workers
  • The job outlook for registered nurses alone is expected to climb by 22 percent from 2008 to 2018.

Government (epidemic preparedness) Market:

  • The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention estimates that at least 40% of the US population will be exposed to either H1N1 or H5N1 viruses
  • The Department of Health and Human Services reports that the US needs approximately 5.3 billion respirators stockpiled during an epidemic/pandemic and only 0.2 percent of that total is currently available

Individual User Market:

  • Approximately 50 million Americans suffer from asthma, COPD, chronic bronchitis, or emphysema.  These people represent a high risk category for infection from airborne pathogens
  • Approximately 70 percent of people who were hospitalized in 2009 due to the H1N1 virus had one or more medical conditions previously recognized as placing these people at “high risk” of serious flu-related complications.
  • In the event of an influenza epidemic/pandemic, retail purchase may play an important role in acquiring PPE (personal protection equipment) for home healthcare workers as well as the general public who would be caring for friends and family members


PRODUCT DESCRIPTION

         ProReactive's first phase product line will include the following

The complete  adult size respirator with Antibacterial 3.0 micron filter in production 

       Proreactive's second phase product line will include the following

Allergen and spore filter model: Allows asthmatics with allergy issues to attain filtration performance levels previously only provided in full face mask systems

Children's size and large adult size will be available 

Efficient antiviral filter's in production

        Proreactive's third phase product line will include the following 

Pre heating and cooling: models designed for COPD patients and others that will allow for relief in cold or hot environments 

Chemical or other pollutant filter allowing the industrial user to have a high preforming seal and convenient replacement filters 


BUSINESS MODEL

ProReactive will generate revenue from both manufacturing  and proprietary replacement filters sales through wholesale distribution channels. Licensing of the design rights to clients in non-North American markets is under consideration. A PCT has been filed to ensure foreign rights are appropriately retained for the licensing activity.


Revenue from Production:

Revenue from North American production will be generated for each market segment as follows:

Healthcare:

Our first strategy is to open the door into the massive healthcare industry where there is a significant need for a new and improved respiratory mask.  With the improvements and the cost savings that this product will offer, we will take advantage of the many contacts that have already made.  NIOSH/CDC approval will be vital to attain this goal as they approve almost everything sold within the hospital market for PPE. These sales will occur through both DME agents and organizations for nurse practitioners, Wonks, RN's and other hospital staff. Independent practitioners in the medical field such as Doctors,Dentists, etc. have been contacted with favorable responses. 

Police and First Responders:

The next market to enter would be police and first-responders, as there are many uses for our product in these areas.  These individuals need better protection in their daily work duties when needed in the event of  an infectious decease out brake, unexpected Chemical releases and actions of bioterrorism.  Sales to these agencies will be through direct agency leader solicitation.  Favorable contacts have already been established with the Michigan State Police and a contingent order will be sought.

Military:

With 3 million active and reserve military personnel, the Department of Defense could become a substantial buyer of ProReactive masks and filter’s. Specific applications and contacts have been made.  Informal testing has been done in a military environment with favorable results.  

Industrial:

The next market to enter would be construction workers, industrial laborers, welders and individuals doing various jobs while being exposer to potentially harmful inhalants. Phase 3 will include a diagnostic evaluation of the used work site filter for chemical, metals and other materials in optimizing filter performance.


Civilian sector:

Individuals doing various work on home and gardening projects who may want to reduce the intake of seasonal allergens , pollen, dust and other irritants. Obviously persons with respiration problems would purchase our produce on basis of their need.


Travel:

2.5 Million people travel by air in the USA daily. Others versions of close proximity mass transit are Subways, Busses and ships. In all cases there is a common air volume. Many of these persons may have respiratory issues and would like the protection and ease of mind.




Revenue Growth Projections

For North American Production, the initial orders will be taken as contingent upon NIOSH certification. The NIOSH certification process will take less than 3 months.  Then in Q4 2015  A limited number of units will be produced and distributed. By Q1  of 2016 production and distribution will be increasing at a rate dependent on capital availability.



MANAGEMENT TEAM

Alexander J. Walacavage, Owner/Inventor

Mr Walacavage has extensive experience in the medical setting doing hands on patient care with burn and wound care patients. He has many years of experience working closely with doctors and staff, which helped him to realize the need for new products, and applications for existing devices. Some of these products include vacuum assisted wound treatments, Fistulas closure devices, and wound care dressings.  Mr. Walacavage was an Owner/Manager of Advanced Medical Research of Okemos Michigan Developing medical Products for Acies Health Care Inc. 2005-2007.  He has also developed a proprietary new non-contact device that will assist doctors in making initial patient assessment faster, safer and cheaper.

Dr. Jack Holland, Senior Scientist

As an Emeritus Professor of Biochemistry, Jack is the author of over 200 scientific papers, book chapters, and abstracts.  He holds several patents in the areas of optical, electronic, and computerized measurement systems.  He is presently active as a consultant for American Energy Services, Lansing Consultants, and Modern Medical Technologies.  He has been active as a consultant for CDC , Dow Chemical , Detroit Edison, LECO Corporation and other agencies and industries. He will serve ProReactive as an advisor in the areas of system configuration and integration, clinical study strategy and evaluation, and IP applications.

Kerby F. Fannin, M.P.H., Ph.D.

Dr. Kerby F. Fannin is a Qualified Environmental Professional compliant with US EPA Standard 40 CFR Part 312. He has worked as an environmental professional for more than 30 years. His work has included experience in performing Phase 1, Phase 2, and Baseline Environmental Site Assessments. He has also developed air sampling equipment for the US EPA, developed and marketed air cleaning and purifying systems for buildings, tested and evaluated the effectiveness of air cleaners developed by numerous manufacturers, and helped develop the ASHRAE standard for testing air filters.  His primary focus will be on testing the ProReactive mask for face-seal leakage and its effectiveness against various particles. 

Mark Kellogg, J.D., CPA.

Mr. Kellogg, is a partner with the Lansing, Michigan law firm of Fraser Trebilcock Davis & Dunlap, P.C. where he practices in the areas of business and corporate law, taxation, business entity formation and planning (including limited partnerships, limited liability companies, Subchapter S-Corporations, professional corporations and professional limited liability companies, and other joint ventures and business combination structures), Mark is also a Certified Public Accountant.


John Brandenburg, Media Director

John Brandenburg, Media Director

Mr. Brandenburg is an Army veteran and owner of BBGate Studios. He has deployed overseas with the military and has many years of experience in media creation and is the media creator for ProReactive.


Aaron Jenkins

Aaron Jenkins is a retired US Army Public Affairs Officer and Adjunct Professor of Communications at Siena Heights University.  Along the way, Jenkins has served as the Director of the Combined Press Information Center for Multi-National Forces Iraq, responsible for all media in Iraq and the Director of Public Affairs for the Michigan National Guard.  His communications insight has proven invaluable for the ProReactive team.


Funding of $200K is being sought to procure  

Tooling for Final design     {$150K)

Validate final performance {$4K)

Achieve regulatory approval from NIOSH/CDC {$12K) 

 launch production {$34K)


Note: first design component part tooling (prototype) has already been fabricated.

story_txt:
Finally a device designed and
made for people with a challenged immune system or a respiration problem such
as asthma, Copd, cronic bronchitis and others . You can use this device in
situations of a confined air space  shared with others such as an airplane, train,
bus, car and even the doctor’s waiting room. The device can protect you or
others from you at times when you may have a respiratory illness. 
The device is a
self-adjusting face mask with a patent applied no-leak soft bladder which
solves the major problem of face masks, leakage around the edges. The situation
is so bad that people who use face masks in the work regimen must undergo an
expensive and time consuming fit- test yearly to check and try to correct these
leakages. With this mask the user can conveniently self adjust. insuring no
leakage and adequate  operation. When
fully exploited and in volume production this mask will protect from airborne
bacterial and viral pathogens and sell for slightly under $20. We are asking
for help in expediting this development.

Respirators
are commonly used for protection against TB, influenza, bacteria,  and
other airborne pathogens.  There are over 5 million Medical, Industrial, EMS and similar users of conventional
respirators in the US. Approximately 50 million
     Americans suffer from asthma, COPD, chronic bronchitis, or emphysema.  These people represent a high risk
     category for infection from airborne pathogens and they are often unable to effectively fight the ensuing distress.The Institute of
Medicine has reported that the largest problem with these devices is face seal leakage. ProReactive LLC of
Lansing, MI has developed a patent pending respirator which virtually
eliminates this critical issue through an adjustable, inflatable face seal bladder system. 
The
ProReactive respirator further protects users by integrating state of
the art nano-filtration media which allow for previously unobtainable
protection from airborne pathogens such as H1N1, Avian, Swine flu and other viruses.
This new technology has the added benefit of potentially reducing or eliminating
costly mandatory workplace respirator fit testing. The low cost
replaceable filter  and the application of disinfectants on
the re-usable face mask body will substantially reduce the ongoing expense and provide improved  protection for employees. (For single person use) These cost reductions will greatly aid in the preparation for future pandemics by healthcare facility, EMS, public safety department or similar organization. 
WE NEED YOUR HELPOur goal is to raise funding to start producing this innovative item in Michigan and Ohio. This product is revolutionary, reusable and the lack of face mask leakage will make this one of the most effective products on the market. You can join in on the ground floor and be a part of this novel product that will not contribute to the millions of masks that are filling up landfills every day. Our disposable filter housings can be made of a bio-starch that is 99% biodegradable and will contribute little to these crowded landfills.

The Team:
Alex Walacavage-Inventor
Dr. Jack Holland  -Advisor, Professor Emeritus MSU
Dr. Kerry by Fannin- Advisor, Environmental Science
Mark Kellog- Legal Rep, Juris Doctorate
Aaron Jenkins-Communications Director
John Brandenburg-Media Director



PROJECT SUMMARY
 Respirators
are commonly used for protection against TB, Influenza, Bacteria, SARS and
other airborne pathogens.  There are over 5.1 million Medical, Industrial, EMS and similar users of conventional
respirators in the US.  Since the largest problem with these devices is face seal leakage. ProReactive LLC of
Lansing, Mi has developed a patent pending respirator which virtually
eliminates this critical issue through an inflated face seal bladder system. 
The
ProReactive respirator further protects users by integrating state of
the art nano-filtration media which allows for previously unobtainable
protection from airborne pathogens such as H1N1, Avian and the Swine flu
virus. 
This new
technology has the added benefit of potentially reducing or eliminating costly
mandatory workplace respirator fit testing. The low cost
replaceable filter and the application of disinfectant procedures on
the re-usable face mask housing will substantially reduce the ongoing expense  and provide levels of improved protection for employees and the general public. Additionally, the multiple use of the Proreactive mask by a single user will reduce the cost to healthcare facility, EMS, public safety departments, or similar organizations in preparation for a pandemic.               


MARKET ANALYSIS
Research has shown
the following market statistics:
Over five million
American workers are required to wear respirators to protect themselves from
hazards in their workplace. The current market
for a popular N95 respirator (typically disposable) of the type in contrast to the
ProReactive face mask in the United States is at 900 million units annually, the majority
of which are used in a non-medical setting. The Department of
Health and Human Services is intent on both stockpiling as well as increasing
the production of N95 respirators.  The
United States would reportedly need approximately 5.3 billion disposable respirators
during a pandemic situation, only 0.2 percent of which is currently available. There are
regulatory bodies governing the devices in the target markets and these
agencies have spent considerable effort driving improved product performance
with workshops on design improvements for fit testing, user comfort
enhancement, and filtration media optimization. 
Fit testing is a required annual process that assures that a given
respirator fits the individual user.  Although
fit testing costs hospitals and others millions of dollars each year in
man-hours, equipment, and training, it is still mandated due to conventional
product leakage and is critical to protecting the user. 

The
Institute of Medicine states what the design drivers for effective PPE are, and the ProReactive
product exceeds these drivers by providing the following factors:

Improved protection due to face
     seal leakage elimination, and using new technology filter material
The Proreactive face mask will have the ability for the user to do their own fit test ( See Video)
Improved user comfort due to
     inflatable seal system
Reduction in cost due to fit
     testing elimination 
Improved compliance with worker
     health regulations due to dramatically improved protection from airborne
     pathogens and other pollutants.
The ability to cool or heat the Proreactive face mask depending on the users needs
The first phase proreactive face mask's will be made of clear virgin polymers so that the users face will be visible to patients and others

Healthcare
Market:

Healthcare is one of the
     fastest growing markets in the World and will be on the front
     lines delivering care and reducing the spread of any future epidemics and pandemics
Currently, there are over 7,500 US hospitals employing more than 5.1 million workers
The job outlook for registered
     nurses alone is expected to climb by 22 percent from 2008 to 2018.

Government
(epidemic preparedness) Market:

The Centers for Disease Control
     and Prevention estimates that at least 40% of the US population will be
     exposed to either H1N1 or H5N1 viruses
The Department of Health and
     Human Services reports that the US needs approximately 5.3 billion
     respirators stockpiled during an epidemic/pandemic and only 0.2 percent of that
     total is currently available

Individual
User Market:

Approximately 50 million
     Americans suffer from asthma, COPD, chronic bronchitis, or emphysema.  These people represent a high risk
     category for infection from airborne pathogens
Approximately 70 percent of
     people who were hospitalized in 2009 due to the H1N1 virus had one or more
     medical conditions previously recognized as placing these people at “high risk”
     of serious flu-related complications.
In the event of an influenza epidemic/pandemic, retail purchase may play an important role in acquiring PPE
     (personal protection equipment) for home healthcare workers as well as the
     general public who would be caring for friends and family members


PRODUCT DESCRIPTION
         ProReactive's first phase product line will include the following
The complete  adult size respirator with
     Antibacterial 3.0 micron filter in production 

       Proreactive's second phase product line will include the following
Allergen and spore filter model: Allows asthmatics with allergy issues to attain filtration performance levels previously only provided in full face mask systems
Children's size and large adult size will be available 
Efficient antiviral filter's in production
        Proreactive's third phase product line will include the following 
Pre heating and cooling: models designed for
     COPD patients and others that will allow for relief in cold or hot environments 
Chemical or other pollutant filter allowing the industrial user to have a high preforming seal and convenient replacement filters 


BUSINESS MODEL
ProReactive
will generate revenue from both manufacturing  and
proprietary replacement filters sales through wholesale distribution
channels. Licensing of the design rights to clients in non-North American markets is under consideration. A PCT has been filed to ensure
foreign rights are appropriately retained for the licensing activity.

Revenue from Production: 
Revenue
from North American production will be generated for each market segment as follows:
Healthcare:
Our first strategy is to open the door into the massive
healthcare industry where there is a significant need for a new and improved
respiratory mask.  With the improvements
and the cost savings that this product will offer, we will take advantage of
the many contacts that have already made. 
NIOSH/CDC approval will be vital to attain this goal as they approve almost
everything sold within the hospital market for PPE. These sales will occur through both
DME agents and organizations for nurse practitioners, Wonks, RN's and other hospital staff. Independent practitioners in the medical field such as Doctors,Dentists, etc. have been contacted with favorable responses. 
Police and First
Responders:
The next market to enter would be police and
first-responders, as there are many uses for our product in these areas.  These individuals need better protection in
their daily work duties when needed in the event of  an infectious decease out brake, unexpected Chemical releases and actions of bioterrorism.  Sales to
these agencies will be through direct agency leader solicitation.  Favorable contacts have already been established
with the Michigan State Police and a contingent order will be sought. 

Military:
With 3 million active and reserve military personnel, the
Department of Defense could become a substantial buyer of ProReactive masks and
filter’s. Specific applications and contacts have been made.  Informal testing has been done in a military environment with favorable results.  
Industrial:
The next market to enter would be construction workers,
industrial laborers, welders and individuals doing various jobs while being exposer to potentially harmful inhalants. Phase 3 will include a diagnostic evaluation of the used work site filter for chemical, metals and other materials in optimizing filter performance.

Civilian sector:
Individuals doing various work on home and gardening projects who may want to reduce the intake of seasonal allergens , pollen, dust and other irritants. Obviously persons with respiration problems would purchase our produce on basis of their need.

Travel:
2.5 Million people travel by air in the USA daily. Others versions of close proximity mass transit are Subways, Busses and ships. In all cases there is a common air volume. Many of these persons may have respiratory issues and would like the protection and ease of mind.




Revenue Growth Projections

For
North American Production, the initial orders will be taken as contingent upon NIOSH
certification. The NIOSH certification process
will take less than 3 months.  Then in Q4 2015  A limited number of units will be produced and distributed. By Q1  of 2016 production and distribution will be increasing at a rate dependent on capital availability.





MANAGEMENT TEAM
Alexander J. Walacavage, Owner/Inventor
Mr
Walacavage has extensive experience in the medical setting doing hands on
patient care with burn and wound care patients. He has many years of experience
working closely with doctors and staff, which helped him to realize the need
for new products, and applications for existing devices. Some of these products
include vacuum assisted wound treatments, Fistulas closure devices, and wound
care dressings.  Mr. Walacavage was an
Owner/Manager of Advanced Medical Research of Okemos Michigan Developing
medical Products for Acies Health Care Inc. 2005-2007.  He has also developed a proprietary new
non-contact device that will assist doctors in making initial patient
assessment faster, safer and cheaper. 
Dr. Jack Holland,
Senior Scientist
As an

papers, book chapters, and abstracts.  He
holds several patents in the areas of optical, electronic, and computerized
measurement systems.  He is presently
active as a consultant for American Energy Services, Lansing
Consultants, and Modern Medical Technologies.  He has been active as a consultant for CDC , Dow Chemical , Detroit Edison, LECO Corporation and other agencies and industries. He will serve ProReactive as an advisor in the areas of system
configuration and integration, clinical study strategy and evaluation, and IP
applications.
Kerby F. Fannin,
M.P.H., Ph.D.
Dr. Kerby
F. Fannin is a Qualified Environmental
Professional compliant with US EPA Standard 40 CFR Part 312. He has
worked as an environmental professional for more than 30 years. His work has
included experience in performing Phase 1, Phase 2, and Baseline Environmental
Site Assessments. He has also developed air sampling equipment for the US
EPA, developed and marketed air cleaning and purifying systems for buildings,
tested and evaluated the effectiveness of air cleaners developed by numerous
manufacturers, and helped develop the ASHRAE standard for testing air
filters.  His primary focus will be on
testing the ProReactive mask for face-seal leakage and its effectiveness
against various particles. 
Mark Kellogg, J.D., CPA.
Mr.
Kellogg, is a partner with the Lansing, Michigan law firm of Fraser Trebilcock
Davis & Dunlap, P.C. where he practices in the areas of business and
corporate law, taxation, business entity formation and planning (including

professional corporations and professional limited liability companies, and
other joint ventures and business combination structures), Mark is also a
Certified Public Accountant.

John Brandenburg, Media Director
John Brandenburg, Media Director
Mr. Brandenburg is an Army veteran and owner of BBGate Studios. He has deployed overseas with the military and has many years of experience in media creation and is the media creator for ProReactive.


Aaron Jenkins
Aaron Jenkins is a retired US Army Public Affairs Officer and Adjunct Professor of Communications at Siena Heights University.  Along the way, Jenkins has served as the Director of the Combined Press Information Center for Multi-National Forces Iraq, responsible for all media in Iraq and the Director of Public Affairs for the Michigan National Guard.  His communications insight has proven invaluable for the ProReactive team.

story:
Every ten minutes, someone in America will die because of Blood Cancer. 

Summary: No More Blood Cancer

Rock the Socks has embarked on a 10 week campaign to raise 50,000 dollars, to fund a Cancer Research Grant.  We are holding events, an IndieGoGo campaign, and asking every friend and family member for their support.  Please join us in this fight against cancer! 

  • 100% of the proceeds raised on IndieGoGo will directly fund the Leukemia & Lymphoma Society's fight against Blood Cancer.
  • Rock the Socks is a fashion brand, designing socks to raise funds and awareness for worthy causes.
  • Every ten minutes, someone in America will die because of Blood Cancer.  We can change the world.  

What We Need & What You Get

No matter what, LLS will benefit from this campaign, but by reaching our goal, we will be on our way to funding a cancer research grant and making sure the doctors and researchers who are looking for a cure, find it. 

  • We need $50,000 to fund a cancer research grant through the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society, the largest donors to blood cancer research in the United States.   
  • By getting involved in our campaign you will not only have the satisfaction of playing a positive role in the fight against blood cancer but limited edition attire and a handful of once in a lifetime experiences.   
  • All funds will be donated to the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society regardless of reaching the goal or not...we are committed to making a difference. 

The Impact

This is what researchers have described as an 'exciting' time for cancer research. In the recent years treatment has advanced more than it had in the previous 30 years prior. This is why we chose to highlight the advances in a documentary as well as launch this campaign to make sure the advances in treatment and prevention continue to advance.   

  • Most of you reading this have felt or seen first hand the pain that cancer can cause, EVERYONE reading this can be effected in the future. We must continue to advance research, your very life may depend on it someday.   
  • We want more than anything to be a positive 


Bubble Soccer Tournament 

Have you ever climbed into a bubble and smashed another human? If not, here is a great opportunity to do so in a bubble soccer tournament that will benefit the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society. Hosted by LLS Man and Woman of the year candidates Mary Carrillo & Edward Atienza.

The Perks




About the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society?

The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society is the world’s largest voluntary health organization dedicated to funding blood cancer research, education and patient services. LLS’s mission is to cure leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin’s disease and myeloma, and to improve the quality of life of patients and their families. LLS created the Information Resource Center (IRC) to provide blood cancer patients, their families and health professionals accurate, current disease information and support. IRC information specialists are social workers, nurses and health educators.



About Rock the Socks

Rock the Socks is a philanthropic fashion sock line committed to raising funds and awareness for much needed social causes.  

  • We design socks specifically for causes that are important to us then we donate a portion of our proceeds to a non-profit organization that is leading the way in the cause we are fighting for. 
  • We are currently partnered with 5 non-profit organizations one of the great Leukemia and Lymphoma Society.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute with funds, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • We are looking for world wide Brand Ambassadors to actively spread the world of our campaign.  Get involved! Email us at yourock@rockthesocks.org for your your Brand Ambassador Kit!
  • Simply sharing this campaign is a huge help to us and the The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society, please help spread the word and stop cancer for good.

story:
Jyoti recently underwent surgery to remove the cancer and now is facing a long road to recovery. Jyoti had to take a leave of absence from her waitressing job to fight this unexpected medical crisis and now she and her daughter are facing a financial crunch while Jyoti is on her journey to being cancer-free. ​

Jyoti has worked tirelessly to provide for her daughter and finish her Bachelor of Social Work degree because her passion is helping people and making a difference. I want to raise $2000 to help her get back on her feet so that she can continue to pursue her dreams while raising her beautiful daughter. Any money I raise will go towards Jyoti's housing, transportation, and medical expenses until she can return to work. Please help me help Jyoti... she's an amazing, generous, loving person and would be the first one to help anyone else in need.
